name: orange julius with the secret ingredient ; ingredients: oranges, ice, water, milk, powdered coffee creamer, sugar ; preparation:Add ice and water to blender and turn on high for a few seconds. Add orange sections about 5 at a time, blending a little as you go. Add the other ingredients in whatever order and blend until smooth. Taste. Add more creamer or sugar if necessary. I use small to medium size seedless, sweet oranges. ; name: orange dream ; ingredients: orange juice, milk, sugar, pure vanilla extract, ice cube, orange slice ; preparation:In blender container combine orange juice, milk, sugar and vanilla. Cover. Blend until mixed. With the blender running, add ice cubes, 1 at a time, through lid opening. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Garnish on the rim with orange slices, if desired. ; name: fresh orange curd ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, fresh orange juice, eggs, butter, orange rind ; preparation:Combine sugar and cornstarch in a 3-quart saucepan. Gradually whisk in juice. Whisk in lightly beaten eggs. Bring to a boil over medium heat, whisking constantly, 1-2 minutes or until mixture reaches a pudding like thickness. Remove from heat. Whisk in butter and orange rind. Cover, placing plastic wrap directly on curd. Chill 8 hours. ; name: apricot and brandy jam ; ingredients: dried apricot halves, water, orange, sugar, almond extract, brandy ; preparation:Combine apricots and water in a bowl, cover, and let stand overnight, or until soft and well plumped. Combine apricots and their soaking water in saucepan with the orange peel and juice and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and bring to boil, while stirring. Boil gently, stirring often, until the mixture is thick and shiny and begins to clear the sides of the pan when stirred. While mixture thickens, be sure to stir it continually but gently, so that the fruit does not burn or get squashed. Do not allow the mixture to cook down to a puree. It should retain good-sized bits of apricot. Remove the preserve from heat and stir in almond extract and brandy. Ladle into 3 half-pint canning jars, prepared in usual manner and seal with sterilized 2 piece screw-on lids. Cool and let mellow several weeks or more before serving. ; name: orange ice cream soda ; ingredients: blood orange juice, orange juice, white sugar, club soda, vanilla ice cream, orange slice ; preparation:Rub orange juice on the edge of glass and then place the glass in white sugar to rim glass. Set the prepared glass in freezer to chill until needed. Next dissolve the 4 tsps of sugar in 6 tbsp of orange juice. Pour the orange mixture into the prepared glass. Add the club soda and top with ice cream. Pour the remaining orange juice and sugar over the ice cream and garnish glass with an orange slice. Serve with a straw and a spoon, enjoy immediately. Please use the same measurements for liqueurs as for juice. If using sodas instead of juice or liqueurs, please substitute the club soda with your preferred soda,. ; name: orange glaze ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, orange juice, lemon juice, salt, butter ; preparation:Mix sugar& cornstarch in pan. Add juices, stirring well. Add salt& butter. Cook over low heat til thick& clear. Cool& frost. ; name: chocolate orange fudge ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, pecans, orange zest ; preparation:Line a 8x8x2-inch baking pan with lightly buttered waxed paper or aluminum foil. Set aside. Melt chocolate chips with condensed milk in the top of a double boiler or in a bowl in the microwave. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in pecans and grated orange peel. Spread in prepared dish and chill until firm. Carefully remove fudge from pan using the edges of the foil. Cut into squares. Store covered in refrigerator. ; name: liqueur oranges ; ingredients: oranges, caster sugar, vanilla bean, orange-flavored liqueur, brandy ; preparation:

name: absolutely best brownies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, salt, self-rising flour, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour a 9 x 9-inch pan. In a bowl, beat together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Combine the cocoa, salt, and flour together. Stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the walnuts. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm. ; name: lazy gourmet s chocolate brownies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, brown sugar, cocoa, eggs, flour, baking powder, vanilla, walnuts ; preparation:In a large bowl, sift flour and baking powder. Set aside. In a large saucepan, melt the butter. Add the white sugar, brown sugar and cocoa. Blend well. Beat in 1 egg at a time. Add flour and blend well. Add vanilla and walnuts, mixing well. Pour into prepared 9 x 13 pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Centre will be firm but not hard. ; name: hazelnut chocolate brownies ; ingredients: hazelnuts, dark chocolate, butter, eggs, brown sugar, vanilla, plain flour, baking powder ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 160 c. Grease 16 x 16 cms pan and line with baking paper. Melt chocolate and butter together in bowl over saucepan of boiling water. Cool slightly. Beat eggs, sugar and vanilla with electric beaters till thick and pale. Stir in cooled chocolate. Sift in flour and baking powder, stir till just combined. Add hazelnuts, mix in well. Pour into prepared pan, bake for 35 - 40 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes then turn onto wire rack. ; name: glazed brownies ; ingredients: sugar, butter, water, semisweet chocolate morsels, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, eggs, pecans ; preparation:Cook first 3 ingredients in a large saucepan over high heat stirring constantly, until sugar melts. Add 2 cups chocolate morsels and vanilla, stirring until mixture is smooth. Let cook 15 minutes. Add flour, baking soda, and salt to cooled chocolate mixture, stirring until blended. Stir in eggs and pecans until blended. Spread batter into a greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 325 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle remaining 2 cups chocolate morsels evenly over warm brownies and let stand 5 minutes to soften. Spread over top. Cool on wire rack before cutting. ; name: tanner s brownies ; ingredients: oleo, sugar, flour, eggs, cocoa, vanilla ; preparation:Melt oleo in medium saucepan. After melted. In same pan add all the other ingredients. Stir well and pour into a 8x8 pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: light chocolate chip oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: margarine, dark brown sugar, egg, vanilla, cinnamon, whole wheat flour, baking powder, oats, dark chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine margarine, sugar, egg, vanilla and cinnamon. Stir until creamy and smooth. I microwave the margarine for about 30 seconds to soften. Add flour and baking powder and stir until completely combined. Add oats and then chocolate chips. Spoon onto greased cookie sheets with a soup spoon with about an inch between each cookie. Bake at 350 f for 11 minutes. I used two sheets in the oven at once, and if you do that, switch the bottom sheet with the top sheet after about 5 minutes and then continue cookie. Let cool. ; name: walnut brownie bites ; ingredients: walnuts, butter, dark chocolate, brown sugar, egg, plain flour, sour cream, rolo chocolates ; preparation:Preheat oven to moderate. Lightly grease 2 non-stick 12 hole mini muffin pans. Divide walnuts among holes. Stir butter and chocolate in small saucepan over low heat until smooth. Stir in sugar, cool to just warm. Stir in egg, then flour and cream. Spoon mixture into prepared pan. Press one rolo into centre of each quantity of mixture. Spread mixture so that rolo is completely enclosed. Bake in oven about 15 minutes. Using a sharp pointed knife, loosen sides of brownies from pan, stand 10 minutes. Remove brownies gently from pan. ; name: silver state brownies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, flour, nuts, mini chocolate chip ; preparation:

name: pineapple bread bread machine ; ingredients: pineapple juice, water, egg, butter, sugar, salt, bread flour, active dry yeast, candied pineapple ; preparation:In bread machine pan, place the first eight ingredients in order suggested by manufacturer. Select basic bread setting. Choose crust color and loaf size if available. Bake according to bread machine directions. Just before final kneading, add the pineapple if desired. ; name: diet pineapple muffins ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, artificial sweetener, salt, margarine, crushed pineapple, egg ; preparation:Combine flour, baking powder, sweetner and salt. Add melted butter. Add beaten egg and 19 oz tin of crushed pineapple. Ingredients will be very thick in texture. Line your muffin pan cups with cupcake papers. Bake 18 minutes at 400f. ; name: one bowl pineapple cake ; ingredients: sugar, flour, eggs, baking soda, vanilla, nuts, crushed pineapple in juice ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f. Grease and flour a 9x13 size pan. Put all the ingredients into one large mixing bowl. Mix well. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until done. ; name: mary s pineapple cake ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, eggs, margarine, evaporated milk, coconut, pecans ; preparation:Mix all the cake ingredients together with a spoon. Bake in a greased 9 x13 inch pan for 35 to 40 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit. While the cake bakes make the topping. Bring margarine, sugar and evaporated milk to a boil. Stirring occasionally. Boil for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in coconut and nuts. Pour this mixture over the cake as soon as it comes from the oven. ; name: pineapple drops diabetic ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar substitute, sugar substitute, egg, vanilla, flour, baking powder, baking soda, unsweetened crushed canned pineapple ; preparation:Cream margarine and sugars. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until fluffy. Combine dry ingredients and combine with cream mixture alternately with pineapple. Mix throughly. Drop by spoonfuls on lightly greased cookie sheets spacing 2 to 3 inches apart. Bake 375f 10-12 minutes. ; name: cherry pineapple nut cake ; ingredients: crushed pineapple in syrup, cherry pie filling, yellow cake mix, pecans, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9 baking dish. Spread pineapple with juice evenly in dish. Spread cherry pie filling over pineapple. Sprinkle dry cake mix over cherries, then spread pecans over cake mix. Cut margarine into thin slices and place over pecans. Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired. ; name: country pineapple casserole ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, crushed pineapple, lemon juice, day-old white bread ; preparation:Cream the butter and sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating the mix well after each egg is added. Stir in the pineapple and lemon juice. Fold in the bread cubes. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 cake pan or baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 325 degrees until set. ; name: amazing pineapple bread ; ingredients: butter, splenda sugar substitute, sugar, egg substitute, crushed pineapple, flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, vanilla ; preparation:

name: fudgecake ; ingredients: biscuit, eggs, butter, caster sugar, cocoa powder, walnuts, sultana, vanilla, chocolate icing ; preparation:Put biscuits in to a plastic bag and seal end, with a rolling pin crush them till they are broken in to small pieces. Lightly beat eggs. In a small pot gently melt butter and stir in the sugar and cocoa. Remove from heat, cool to lukewarm and stir in the eggs. Return to the heat and stir until the mixture is smooth and thick and just starting to boil. Remove from heat and stir in walnuts, sultanas and vanilla. Then stir in biscuit crumbs. Mix well and press lightly into a lightly buttered sponge roll tin. Set aside in a cool place for a couple of hours. Ice with your fav chocolate butter icing and cut into bars. ; name: betty crocker fudge brownies homemade ; ingredients: sugar, flour, cocoa, salt, baking powder, eggs, oil, vanilla ; preparation:Mix all these ingredients together with a whisk and dump them into a ziploc to save. Should be good in the pantry for 6 months. When making the brownies, preheat oven to 350f. Add eggs, oil and vanilla and mix with a fork til just blended. Do not overmix. Pour into a silicone or buttered 9x9 pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes. ; name: remarkable fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, semi-sweet chocolate chips, marshmallow cream, vanilla, nuts ; preparation:Butter side of heavy 3-quart pan. Combine sugar, milk & butter. Cook over medium heat to 236f, stirring frequently. Remove from heat & add chocolate, marshmallow cream, vanilla & nuts. Beat until chocolate is melted & blended. Pour into pan. ; name: sinful brownies ; ingredients: butter, dark chocolate, eggs, sugar, golden syrup, plain flour, cocoa, salt, nuts ; preparation:Pre heat oven 180c. Butter 20cm square cake tin. Melt butter and choc in saucepan over low heat. When melted ans smooth, set aside to cool. Beat eggs and sugar in large bowl till thick and creamy. Stir n cooled chocolate and golden syrup. Then add flour, cocoa, salt and nuts. Pour into tin, bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven, cool in tin then cut into squares. ; name: no bake fudge cookies ; ingredients: sugar, milk, salt, cocoa, margarine, vanilla, peanut butter, oatmeal ; preparation:Mix first 6 ingredients in a sauce pan and cook until it boils. Boil for 1-3 minutes. Remove from heat and add peanut butter and oatmeal. Drop by teaspoonfuls on to wax paper. Chill until set. ; name: fudgy orange brownies ; ingredients: sugar, oil, eggs, orange, zest of, fresh orange juice, vanilla, flour, salt, baking powder, cocoa powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Mix together oil and sugar. Add eggs, vanilla, zest, and juice. Mix well. Sift together dry ingredients. Add to wet mixture, stirring gently until just combined. Pour into greased 8x8 baking pan. Bake 20-23 minutes until done. Allow to sit at room temperature at least 30 minutes before cutting. Let me know how long it took you to bake them. ; name: cocoa fudge 1965 ; ingredients: white sugar, brown sugar, salt, cocoa powder, corn syrup, sour cream, butter, vanilla extract, walnuts ; preparation:Mix sugars, salt, cocoa, syrup, and sour cream in a large buttered saucepan. Cook without stirring until candy temp. Reaches 235 degrees f. Or until a soft ball forms in very cold water. Add butter. Stir just til blended. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Let sit until cool. Add chopped nuts. Beat until creamy, and just until it starts to loose its glossy appearance dulls slightly. Pour into prepared buttered 8 x8 inch pan. Cut into squares while still soft and warm. ; name: deliciously sinful fudge brownies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, dutch-processed cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: mom s broccoli cauliflower salad ; ingredients: cauliflower head, broccoli florets, red onion, miracle whip, sugar, red wine vinegar, sunflower seeds, raisins, bacon ; preparation:Chop cauliflower, broccoli and red onion. Toss them together in a large bowl. In another bowl whisk the miracle whip, sugar and red wine vinegar until smooth. Toss dressing with the cauliflower, broccoli and red onion. Fold the rest of ingredients in and stir together. For best results refrigerate overnight. ; name: broccoli pasta salad ; ingredients: medium pasta shells, mayonnaise, white vinegar, sugar, broccoli florets, red onion, golden raisin, bacon, sunflower seeds ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Combine mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar in mixing bowl. Mix well. Add pasta, broccoli, onion, raisins, bacon and sunflower seeds. Mix gently. Cover. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend. ; name: spicy broccoli salad ; ingredients: broccoli florets, red bell pepper, miniature corn cobs, red onion, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, light brown sugar, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Steam broccoli florets for 2 minutes, then rinse quickly in cold water. Drain well. Place broccoli in serving bowl, adding the onions, bell peppers, and miniature corn. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil, brown sugar and red pepper flakes. Just before serving toss dressing with vegetables. Season with salt. ; name: broccoli slaw salad with apple brocco slaw ; ingredients: broccoli, granny smith apple, mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, honey, salt, pepper ; preparation:Place brocco slaw and apple in a bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise, vinegar, honey and salt and pepper. Pour over brocco slaw and apple. Mix well, with your hands. Serve. ; name: cool summer veggie salad ; ingredients: cilantro, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, white onion, red pepper, lemon, lime ; preparation:Chop cilantro, cucumber, onion, pepper. Cut grape tomatoes in half. Combine everything in bowl. Squeeze half the lemon in bowl. Squeeze the whole lime in bowl. Mix everything together. ; name: southern cabbage salad with sweet onion and peppers ; ingredients: cabbage, bell peppers, carrot, onion, lemon, juice and zest of, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Mix vegetables in a large bowl. Thoroughly combine lemon zest, lemon juice, vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper. Whisk in oil. Fold into vegetables. Season to taste with salt. Store up to 12 hours in the refrigerator to marry flavors. Return to room temperature before serving. ; name: fresh tomato and roasted garlic salad dressing ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, tomatoes, lemon juice, scallions, vinegar, basil ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Brush the garlic cloves with 1 teaspoon of the oil, reserving the remaining oil. Roast the oiled garlic cloves in a pan until golden and soft, about 10 to 15 minutes. Watch carefully so garlic does not get over-brown or burn. Carefully remove pan from oven and cool. When cool enough to handle, squeeze out the garlic pulp. Combine the pulp with the reserved olive oil and rest of the ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth and use the dressing on any mixed garden salad. Refrigerate leftover. ; name: summer broccoli salad ; ingredients: sugar, vinegar, miracle whip, bacon, cheddar cheese, broccoli, onion ; preparation:

name: whiskey lemonade ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, crown royal whiskey, simple syrup, ice ; preparation:To make simple syrup, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely before using. To store, refrigerate up to 2 months. In a glass, combine lemon juice, whiskey and simple syrup over ice. Add a splash of water if desired. Enjoy. ; name: old fashioned lemon balm lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, lemon balm leaves, sugar, boiling water, water, ice, lemon balm ; preparation:Scrub the lemons well. Peel the rind thinly, avoiding the white pithe, and set aside the lemons. Place the lemon rind, lemon balm leaves, and the sugar into a small heat-proof pitcher. Pour the boiling water into the pitcher and stir well, crushing the lemon balm leaves to release their flavor. Leave mixture to infuse for about 15 minutes. Now, cut the lemons in half and squeeze out the juice. Strain juice into a large glass pitcher, add a few fresh sprigs of lemon balm, and add the cooled, strained syrup. Top up with water or half-water half-ice, and chill until needed. ; name: persian lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, water, caster sugar, orange blossom water, ice ; preparation:Cut the lemons in half and juice half the lemons. Thinly slice the remaining lemons and place in a heatproof bowl. Combine the lemon juice, water and sugar in a large saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and pour warm juice over the lemon slices. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 4 hours to chill and develop the flavours. Stir through the orange blossom water. Divide ice evenly among serving glasses. Pour over the lemonade to serve. ; name: chewy lemon bars ; ingredients: lemon cake mix, egg, butter, powdered sugar, eggs, cream cheese, vanilla ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together cake mix, egg and butter. Spread into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan. In a separate bowl, mix together powedered sugar, beaten eggs, softened cream cheese, and vanilla until smooth. Spread mixture over bottom layer. Bake 30-40 minutes, until top layer turns a light golden brown. ; name: chunky strawberry lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, lime, strawberry, sugar, cold water ; preparation:Rinse and hull strawberries, put in bowl and sprinkle with the 2 t. Sugar, set aside. Squeeze the lemons and limes into large bowl or gallon jar. Add the 2 cups sugar and half the water. Stir until sugar is disolved, add the remaining water. With a potato masher or fork, mash the strawberries, but leave semi chunky. Add to lemonade, stir well. ; name: pink lemonade meringue pie ; ingredients: unflavored gelatin, frozen pink lemonade concentrate, evaporated milk, pie shell, cold water, sugar, red food coloring ; preparation:Bake pie shell first, then cool. In a small saucepan, soften gelatin in cold water. Add lemonade concentrate to the gelatin and then stir in sugar until dissolved. Chill completely. Chill evaporated milk in a small bowl in th freezer until crystals form on the edges. Beat milk in the chilled bowl on high speed until stiff. Fold into chilled gelatin mix and add food coloring with a whisk. Pour into pie shell. Chill for a minimum of 3-4 hurs until it sets. ; name: lime mango surprise ; ingredients: mangoes, lime, lemongrass, sugar, ice cream, mint ; preparation:Place your prepared mango in a serving dish. In a pot add the lime juice, lemongrass and sugar. Heat gently, no boiling until the sugar is completely dissolved. Do not use juice until it is completely cooled. Strain the juice and pour over the mango wedges. Sprinkle with the lime rind, cover, chill for at least 3 hours. Serve in small bowls with a scoop of ice cream or sherbert and garnish with the sprigs of mint. ; name: barcardi limon lemonade ; ingredients: ice, bacardi limon, lemonade, lemon concentrate, lime, lemon ; preparation:

name: raspberry rave ; ingredients: red raspberries, crushed pineapple, raspberry gelatin powder, boiling water, sour cream ; preparation:In sieve, drain berries and pineapple over a bowl. Press the fruit with spoon until you have 2 cups juice. In med bowl, dissolve the gelatin in the boiling water. Stir in the 2 cups of juice, the fruit, and the sour cream until blended well. Pour into serving bowl and chill until firm. ; name: cranberries in red wine ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, sugar, full-bodied red wine, cinnamon sticks, orange rind ; preparation:Pick over cranberries, removing stems and any shriveled berries. Rinse under running water, drain. Combine sugar and wine in a non-corrosive heavy medium suacepan. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly, over moderate heat. Stir in cranberries, cinnamon stick, and orange peel. Increase heat to high, return mixture to boil, stirring constantly. Reduce to medium low heat and simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally until berries burst - about 10- 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Discard cinnamon stick. Lift out orange peel, cool slightly, and cut into thin julienne strips. Return peel to berries. Serve warm. ; name: english bishop ; ingredients: orange, whole cloves, cinnamon stick, allspice berries, port wine, honey, cognac ; preparation:Cut the orange almost in half. Sprinkle the inside with crushed cloves. And place cinnamon stick inside. Pierce the orange with small slices to make easier placing the cloves into the orange. Bake it in the oven on low heat for 30-40 minutes. Cut the baked oranges into quarters and squeeze juice into a saucepan with peels. Add 1 cup water, simmer 5 minutes. Pour in the remaining ingredients. Simmer gently for 10-15 minutes - do not boil or the flavor of the port will be spoiled. Strain and serve in warm mugs or in cordial glasses. ; name: strawberry shag ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, powdered sugar, basil sprig, ice, vodka, lemon juice, soda water ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine the strawberries and sugar, toss well. Let sit for 15 minutes. In a cocktail shaker, combine the basil and strawberries and any juice collected in the bowl. Gently crush using a muddler or wooden spoon. Fill the shaker with ice, then add the vodka and lemon juice. Cap the shaker. Shake vigorously. Pour into a large glass, then top with soda water. Stir. Garnish with a strawberry and fresh basil. ; name: berries with pepper sauce ; ingredients: lemon, sugar, water, orange juice, green peppercorn, strawberry, fresh mint leaves, half-and-half ; preparation:Finely grate peel from lemon and put into a saucepan. Squeeze juice from lemon and reserve. Add sugar and water to lemon peel and heat gently, stirring until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and boil until syrup turns a light caramel color. Remove from heat and hold pan handle with a cloth as mixture will splatter. Stir in lemon and orange juices. Heat gently, stirring to dissolve caramel. Stir in peppercorns and boil 3-4 minutes or until slightly thickened and syrupy. Allow to cool 2 minutes, then spoon hot syrup over strawberries. Garnish with mint, if desired, and serve at once with half-and-half, if desired. ; name: blackberry nectar ; ingredients: blackberries, water, tartaric, sugar ; preparation:Dissolve acid in water. Pour over the berries. Let this sit for 24 hours. After 24 hours, strain the juice. Add 3 cups of sugar for each pint of juice and mix well. Bottle the juice. To serve, add water to the nectar just like you would with any juice that needs to be diluted. ; name: blackberry sour cream pie ; ingredients: fresh blackberries, sour cream, flour, sugar, salt, fine breadcrumbs, butter, unbaked pie shell ; preparation:Combine one cup sugar, sour cream, flour, and salt. Place berries in pie shell. Spread sour cream mixture on top. Combine bread crumbs and 2 tablespoons. Sugar, and butter. Sprinkle on top. Bake 375f degrees for 40-45 minutes or until done. ; name: layered berries in port ; ingredients: red currant jelly, port wine, orange rind, cherries, red currants, blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, mint ; preparation:

name: tropical party punch ; ingredients: water, sugar, pineapple juice, frozen orange juice concentrate, frozen lemonade concentrate, almond extract, carbonated lemon-lime beverage ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add pineapple juice, concentrates and extract. Cover and freeze. Remove from freezer 1-2 hours before serving. Just before serving, mash the mixture with a potato masher and stir in lemon-lime soda. ; name: chocolate and chai frappe ; ingredients: chai tea teabags, boiling water, whipping cream, chocolate syrup, caster sugar, ice ; preparation:Place tea bags into a cup and add the boiling water. Add sugar and leave the tea to draw for 2-3 minutes. Discard the teabags and cool slightly. Place cream, tea mixture and chocolate syrup in a blender and pulse quickly. Add the ice and process until smooth. Pour in to 2 tall glasses and serve. ; name: tropical rainfall ; ingredients: orange juice, apple juice, light hawaiian punch, cracked ice, carbonated lemon-lime beverage ; preparation:Pour the juices into a pitcher. Stir. Pop in the fridge to chill. Serve over ice or make an ice ring. If you add any soda, do not add until just before serving. ; name: blueberry mango and ginger parfait ; ingredients: limes, mangoes, blueberries, crystallized ginger, whipped cream ; preparation:Grate rind from one lime and set aside. Squeeze 3 tablespoons juice from limes. Toss together mangoes, blueberries, lime juice and candied ginger. Spoon into parfait glasses. Top with whipped cream or yogurt and sprinkle with reserved grated lime zest. ; name: berry syrup ; ingredients: water, sugar, berries, vanilla, lemon juice ; preparation:In a small saucepan combine water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in berries. Cook until the berries have mostly broken down, approximately 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and lemon juice. Enjoy. ; name: lime and lemonade ; ingredients: frozen lemonade concentrate, ice cubes, lime juice, limes, carbonated lemonade ; preparation:Place ice cubes, lime juice and frozen lemonade concentrate in a blender, and blend until ice is very fine. Place this lemon slush in a freezer safe tray, cover and freeze for at least two hours. Slice the 8 limes very thin, reserve a few for glasses and the top of the pitcher. Put the remaining limes in a large pitcher. Layer the slush over the sliced limes. Just before serving add the carbonated lemonade. ; name: orange party punch ; ingredients: frozen orange juice concentrate, carbonated lemon-lime beverage, pineapple juice, orange sherbet ; preparation:Prepare orange juice according to package directions. Pour into a punch bowl. Stir in the soda and pineapple juice. Top with scoops of sherbet. Serve immediately. ; name: mango frappe ; ingredients: mangoes, orange juice, lime juice, club soda, ice cubes ; preparation:

name: no fuss chocolate oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, quick oats, chocolate chips ; preparation:In a large bowl cream together butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat in egg. Mix in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in oatmeal and chocolate chips until well blended. On a baking sheet place a ball of dough 2 inches between each other. Bake at 350 degrees f. For about 8-10 minutes. ; name: peachy oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: enriched flour, molasses, baking powder, salt, peach jam, oats, shortening, raisins, brown sugar, egg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 and grease a baking sheet. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Add in the oats and raisins. Mix well. Add molasses, sugar, jam, and shortening to the egg. Blend mixture well. Gradually add flour mixture. Drop by tablespoonfuls 3 inches apart onto baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes. ; name: white chocolate oat cranberry cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, eggs, rolled oats, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, dried cranberries, white chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Witch a electric mixer, beat butter and sugar in medium mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs, mixing well. Combine the oats, flour, salt and baking soda in a separate mixing bowl. Add to butter mixture in several additions, mixing well after each addition. Stir in cranberries and the white chocolate chunks. Drop batter by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: healthier no bake chocolate oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, milk, salt, peanut butter, butter, vanilla extract, rolled oats ; preparation:Mix sugar, cocoa, milk and salt in saucepan. Boil for one minute. Add peanut butter, butter, and vanilla to hot mixture. Stir until combined. Stir in oats thoroughly and drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool thoroughly before removing from paper. ; name: ultimate oatmeal raisin cookies ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, baking soda, ground cinnamon, pure vanilla extract, salt, eggs, oats, flour, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together brown sugar and butter until smooth. Stir in baking soda, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt. Add eggs and stir until blended. Stir in oats, flour and raisins. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet, about 2-inches apart. Bake 9-11 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet at once and cool on wire rack. ; name: bran and fig cookies ; ingredients: dried fig, butter, dark brown sugar, egg, milk, all-bran cereal, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375f. If necessary, soak the figs in boiling water for a few minutes to soften them. Drain them and chop them when cool enough to handle. Cream the butter and brown sugar. Beat in the egg and milk. Mix the dry ingredients. Stir them in, with the chopped figs. Scoop out onto lightly buttered cookie sheets, and press down lightly with a wet fork. I use a small melon baller for evenly sized cookies. Bake for 10 minutes or until firm and lightly browned. ; name: oatmeal raisin bran cookies ; ingredients: raisin bran cereal, whole wheat flour, self-rising flour, butter, sugar, light brown sugar, eggs ; preparation:Preheat your oven to 325f. In a bowl combine cereal, wheat flour, and flour. Set aside. In a larger mixing bowl, cream your butter and sugars til fluffy and airy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture until combined well drop by quarter cup measure on to an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12 to 13 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheet and then cool on a wire rack. ; name: merry mountain trail mix ; ingredients: honey-nut flavor toasted oat cereal, sunflower seeds, sliced almonds, flaked coconut, dried sweetened cranberries, dried apple, golden raisin, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:

name: tasty triple corn fritters ; ingredients: flour, yellow cornmeal, baking powder, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, oil, cream-style corn, whole kernel corn ; preparation:Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup. Combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder, sugar and salt in a medium bowl. Combine eggs, milk, oil and cream style corn in a large bowl. Blend in dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened. Stir in whole kernel corn. In deep fryer or heavy saucepan drop batter by tablespoonfuls and fry in 2-3 inches of hot oil or fat for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Drain on paper towles. ; name: sesame wonton crisps ; ingredients: vegetable oil, cornstarch, wonton wrappers, sesame seeds, kosher salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Stir together oil and cornstarch in a small bowl until combined. Stack wonton wrappers and halve diagonally. Arrange in single layer on a large baking sheet and lightly brush tops with oil mixture. You might not use all of oil mixture at this time. You just need a light brushing to get the seeds and salt to adhere. Sprinkle evenly with sesame seeds and kosher salt and bake in middle of oven until golden brown, 5 to 6 minutes. Transfer crisps to a rack to cool. Crisps can be made 1 day ahead and kept in an airtight container at room temperature. ; name: sunny cornbread muffins ; ingredients: flour, yellow cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, egg, buttermilk, canola oil, whole kernel corn ; preparation:In large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In a small bowl, whisk the egg, buttermilk and oil. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in corn. Fill greased muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake at 400 for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. Serve warm. ; name: corn muffins with sweet red peppers ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, yellow cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, pepper, buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg, sweet red pepper ; preparation:In large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt and pepper. In small bowl, beat together buttermilk, oil and egg, stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in red pepper. Spoon batter into well greased or paper lined muffin cups, filling each two thirds full. Bake in 425f degree oven for 15 minutes or until tester inserted in centre comes out clean. Or bake in 8 inch square baking pan in 425f degree oven for 20 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cut into squares to serve. ; name: cornmeal molasses pancakes ; ingredients: egg, buttermilk, dark molasses, butter, unbleached all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, yellow cornmeal ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the egg, buttermilk, molasses and melted butter. Add the flour, salt, baking soda and baking powder. Add the cornmeal last, stirring just until combined. The batter will be slightly lumpy. Drop by tablespoons ful on a hot greased griddle until bubbles form around the outer edges. Turn and brown on the other side --. Serve with butter and sorghum molasses or maple syrup. ; name: caramelized corn with onions and red bell peppers ; ingredients: fresh corn kernels, olive oil, red bell peppers, onion, garlic clove, fresh cilantro, chili powder ; preparation:Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add corn. Stir until beginning to dry and brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer to small bowl. Add oil to skillet. Heat over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers, onion, and garlic. Saut until peppers are tender, about 8 minutes. Mix in cilantro and chili powder, then corn. Stir until heated through, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: cornbread ww core ; ingredients: yellow cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt, splenda granular, fat free sugar free yogurt, nonfat sour cream, egg ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients in a medium bowl. Mix liquid ingredients in a small bowl. Gently fold the wet into the dry. Pour into a round cake pan, sprayed with pam. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until the edges are a golden brown and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cut into 6 wedges. ; name: beer hush puppies ; ingredients: yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, eggs, beer, onion, jalapeno pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:

name: breakfast bagel sandwich ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, eggs, hot sauce, provolone cheese, turkey, bagels ; preparation:Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium. Add onion and cook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Whisk eggs and hot sauce in a small bowl. Add to hot skillet and cook until eggs set, about 2 minutes. Top with cheese and cook until melted, about 1 minute. Place egg mixture evenly over 4 bagel halves. Top with remaining bagel halves and serve. ; name: double tomato brie sandwiches ; ingredients: sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, italian bread, brie cheese, roma tomatoes, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:In small bowl, combine dried tomatoes, olive oil and vinegar. Cut each loaf of italian bread horizontally in half. Evenly spread dried tomato mixture on cut sides of bread. Arrange brie on bottom halves of both loaves and top with tomato slices and basil leaves. Replace tops of loaves. Slice each loaf into eight pieces. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Also, i like the sun-dried tomatoes packed in lightly salted olive oil and herbs. If you use the unseasoned variety, you may want to lightly salt the tomatoes. ; name: ham cheese and mayo sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, cheese, ham, mayonnaise ; preparation:Spread mayonnaise evenly on two pieces of the bread. Place a piece of cheese on the bread. Place a slice of ham on top of the cheese. Place the other slice of bread on top. Cut in half. Enjoy. ; name: mexican grilled cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, jalapeno jack cheese, taco seasoning mix, salsa, butter ; preparation:Heat a griddle, sandwich maker, or a skillet over medium heat. In small bowl, mix butter and taco seasoning mix. Spread half of mixture on one side of each piece of bread. Put cheese slices onto bread and top with remaining bread slices. Place the sandwiches, buttered sides down, on hot griddle. Spread top sides with remaining butter mixture. Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Serve with salsa as a dip. ; name: italian fried sandwiches ; ingredients: french mustard, bread, cheddar cheese, salami, eggs, olive oil, salt and pepper, oil ; preparation:Spread the mustard evenly over the buttered side of the bread. Arrange the cheese on four slices, and top with the salami and remaining bread. Press firmly together. Beat the eggs and olive oil together, adding salt and pepper to taste. Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan. Dip each sandwich into the egg mixture, fry 2 sandwiches at a time until golden brown, turning with a spatula to crisp both sides. Drain on absorbent kitchen paper and serve. ; name: mediterranean vegetable and chicken sandwich wrap ; ingredients: tortilla, hummus, deli chicken, baby spinach, marinated artichoke hearts, roasted sweet red peppers ; preparation:Spread hummus over the tortilla. Place the slices of chicken down the middle of the tortilla so that the ends of each slice overlap. Arrange the spinach leaves over the chicken. Top with the artichokes and red peppers. Fold over the sides of the tortilla and roll up as you would any other wrap. Cut in half and serve. ; name: aloha sandwiches ; ingredients: bacon, white bread, pineapple, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook bacon until evenly brown. Drain and set aside. Place 8 slices of toast on a baking sheet. Place a slice of pineapple, two slices of bacon and a slice of cheese on each. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve hot. ; name: buenos aires press sandwich ; ingredients: challah, brie cheese, fresh basil, tomatoes, butter ; preparation:

name: herby redcurrant lamb chops ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, red currant jelly, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, lamb loin chops, olive oil ; preparation:In a shallow, non-metallic dish, mix together the red wine vinegar and redcurrant jelly. Strip the leaves from the rosemary stalks, set a few aside to garnish, and finely chop the remainder. Stir into the redcurrant mixture with the garlic. Add the lamb and turn in the mixture. Then allow to marinate for 5-10 minutes. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat, then add the lamb with its marinade and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning halfway through, until the lamb is done to your liking and the sauce has reduced to a sticky consistency. Serve the lamb with mashed potatoes and steamed snow peas. Garnish with the reserved rosemary. ; name: turkish lamb chops ; ingredients: onion, salt, olive oil, fresh thyme leave, lamb loin chops, salt & freshly ground black pepper, lemon wedge ; preparation:Sprinkle the onion with the salt. Squeeze the juice out of the onion and discard it. Add the oil and thyme to the onion. Apply the mixture to both sides of the chops and marinate for 1 hour. Grill chops or broil close to heat source. Season with salt and lots of pepper. Garnish with lemon wedges. ; name: lemon scented lamb ; ingredients: leg of lamb, lemon, fresh garlic, sea salt, fresh ground pepper, plain flour, chicken stock, diced tomatoes, mint jelly ; preparation:Preheat oven to 220c fan forced or 240c normal. Place the lamb in a large oven tray and cut small, deep slits all over the lamb. Then stud with the lemon pieces and garlic slivers then lightly dust lamb with flour and season well, sprinkle with oil. Pour about cup stock into the tray and cook in the oven for 20 minutes. Turn the oven temperature down to 180c fan forced oven or 200c normal oven and cook lamb for about another 50-60 mins for a pink rare meat & longer for medium and longer again for well done, basting and adding some more stock to the tray as you do so. Remove lamb and rest for 10 mins, before carving. While the lamb is resting, degrease the tray and add 1 heaped tbsp flour. Cook over a medium heat, continually stirring, and add the tomatoes, about 1 cup stock and add mint jelly. Stir well and reduce to a gravy consistency, when ready strain the sauce. Slice the lamb and arrange on plates, spoon gravy over and serve. ; name: grilled lamb chops desert style ; ingredients: lamb rib chops, dijon mustard, garlic, balsamic vinegar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, fresh basil ; preparation:In a nonreactive bowl, combine mustard, garlic, vinegar, salt and pepper with 2 teaspoons water. Slowly whisk in olive oil, forming a creamy marinade. Stir in basil. Add the chops to the marinade and coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour and up to four hours. Remove from refrigerator and let sit until arriving at room temperature. Heat grill to very hot. Remove excess marinade from chops and grill uncovered about 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer to a warm platter and serve. Preparation time does not include marinade and sitting time. ; name: asian marinated rack of lamb ; ingredients: rack of lamb, hoisin sauce, honey, dark sesame oil, dry sherry, sesame seeds, black beans, orange zest, curry powder ; preparation:Trim the rack of lamb removing fat and silver skin. Mix the marinade ingredients in a blender jar until well blended. Put the meat in a ziplock bag and pour the marinade over. Seal the bag well and place in refrigerator for 24 hours. Set out the meat and allow to stand at room temperature for 1 hour before cooking. Run the bones under cool water before roasting. Preheat oven to 425 degrees, spray and broiler pan with non-stick cooking spray and place rack meat side down. Place 1 cup of water in bottom of broiler pan, place the pan in the oven and roast uncovered for 30 minutes or until a meat thermometer registers between 145 and 150 degrees for medium-rare. Check the meat a couple of times during cooking. If the water has cooked out of pan, add additional water. To serve, carve the rack into individual chops allowing 2 chops per person. ; name: marinated lemon lamb cutlets or chops ; ingredients: lamb chops, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, rosemary ; preparation:

name: summer squash and carrot casserole ; ingredients: summer squash, onion, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, carrot, herb seasoned stuffing mix, butter ; preparation:Cook squash and onion in boiling, salted water for 5 minutes. Drain. Combine soup and sour cream. Stir in carrots. Fold in squash and onion. Combine stuffing and butter. Spread half of stuffing in bottom of 9x13-inch pan. Spoon squash mixture on top of stuffing. Sprinkle remaining stuffing over top. Bake at 350 degrees, uncovered, for 25-30 minutes. ; name: roasted butternut squash with lime and rosemary ; ingredients: butternut squash, butter, olive oil, lime juice, fresh rosemary, sea salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Peel squash and cut into cubes about 1 inch square. Put squash into plastic mixing bowl, add olive oil, lime juice, and minced rosemary and toss well so squash is all coated with oil. Arrange squash on roasting pan in single layer. Dot with butter. Roast for 40-50 minutes, turning several times, or until squash is quite softened and getting browned on the edges. Season with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper, and serve hot. ; name: butternut squash with garlic and olive oil ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, butternut squash, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cube squash. In a large bowl mix minced garlic and olive oil. Add cubed squash and coat with the oil mixture. Dump all ingredients out of bowl and in to a glass casserole dish. Any size will do really but it will cook faster if it is more spread out. Cook 40-45 minutes, stirring once or twice. Squash is done when it is tender. ; name: herb seasoned squash bake ; ingredients: summer squash, onion, reduced-fat cream of chicken soup, nonfat sour cream, herb seasoned stuffing mix, butter, sage, onion powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a saucepan over medium heat, boil the squash and onion in salted water for 5 minutes. Drain well. Combine the squash, chicken soup, and sour cream. Toss the stuffing mix with butter, sage, and onion powder. Butter a 2 quart casserole dish. Layer half the stuffing in the bottom. Sprinkle half the cheese over the stuffing. Spread the squash over the cheese and top with remaining cheese and then the remaining stuffing. Bake for 30-40 minutes. ; name: zucchini and carrots with garlic and herbs ; ingredients: olive oil, carrot, zucchini, garlic, salt and pepper, fresh parsley, fresh basil leaf, fresh oregano ; preparation:Heat olive oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Add carrots, zucchini and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until just barely tender. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in fresh herbs. Serve immediately. ; name: squash zucchini and potatoes ; ingredients: squash, zucchini, potatoes, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put water in pot add potatoes. Cook potatoes until a little soft. Add vegetables and cook until desired texture of veges. Olive oil or butter can be spread on top. Salt and pepper to desired taste. Since i am always watching my weight i do not put butter or olive oil on top only salt and pepper. ; name: yellow squash with basil ; ingredients: olive oil, yellow squash, garlic, water, salt, black pepper, basil ; preparation:Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute squash until browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add water, salt and pepper. Simmer until squash is tender, 6-7 minutes. Stir in basil. ; name: summer squash with toasted garlic and lime ; ingredients: zucchini, salt, chicken broth, garlic cloves, lime juice, black pepper, dried oregano, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: swiss pork chops with mustard sauce ; ingredients: pork loin chops, flour, salt, pepper, butter, white wine, lemon juice, light cream, dijon mustard, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Dry chops and cover with the flour, salt and pepper. Brown in hot butter on both sides, about 20 minutes. Add wine and lemon juice and simmer for about 45 or 50 minutes, or until tender. Remove to warm serving platter. Make mustard sauce. Stir flour into drippings in skillet until smooth. Stir in cream, mustard and cayenne. Boil, stirring 1 minute. Serve chops with sauce. ; name: cucumber dill dip ww ; ingredients: low-fat cream cheese, low-fat ranch dressing, skim milk, dried dill weed, cucumber, onions ; preparation:Place cream cheese in a mixing bowl and whip with an electric mixer until fluffy. Add dressing, milk and dill weed. Mix well until well blended. Stir in cucumber and onion. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour to allow flavor to blend. ; name: bourbon mustard glazed pork chops ; ingredients: olive oil, pork chops, salt and pepper, grainy mustard, stock, honey, butter, bourbon ; preparation:Preheat oven 400. Place large oven skillet over medium high heat with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Season the chops and sear until deep golden brown. When chops are seared, add 1 tablespoon olive oil along with the mustard, stock, honey and butter. When liquids come up to a bubble, pour bourbon into the skillet, remove from heat and carefully flame with a lighter. Or just continue boiling the sauce and the alcohol will cook away. Season the sauce with salt and pepper, and continue cooking until it starts to thicken, 2-3 minutes. Flip the chops over and transfer the entire pan to the oven to finish cooking, about 5 minutes. ; name: garlic dill crackers ; ingredients: dry ranch dressing mix, extra virgin olive oil, dried dill, garlic granules, lemon pepper, cayenne pepper, oyster crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 175degf. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl, plus cayenne pepper, if using, and stir until well combined. Add crackers, and toss well to combine. Transfer mixture to a baking sheet. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until dry, stirring occasionally. Store in an airtight container. ; name: home baked soft pretzels yum ; ingredients: active dry yeast, water, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, coarse salt, mustard ; preparation:In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Add flour and salt and stir to form a soft dough. Turn dough onto a floured surface and knead until smooth, 4 to 5 times. Place in a greased bowl, cover and let rise for 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Punch down and divide into 20 equal pieces. On a lightly floured surface, roll each piece into a 15 inch rope and twist into a pretzel shape. Combine baking soda and cold water and brush over each pretzel. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Place on non stick baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with assorted mustards. ; name: mustard ham sauce ; ingredients: sugar, flour, eggs, prepared mustard, vinegar, beef bouillon, butter ; preparation:Stir flour and sugar together. Add eggs and mix well. Add remaining ingredients. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thick. Serve hot over ham. Refrigerate leftover sauce to use for sandwiches. ; name: dijon catfish w crunchy honey mustard pretzel crust ; ingredients: catfish fillets, egg, dijon mustard, milk, pepper, flour, honey mustard pretzels, vegetable oil, lemon slice ; preparation:Rinse fish with cold water, pat dry with papertowels. In small bowl, whisk together egg, mustard, milk, and pepper until smooth. Pour mixture into a shallow dish or pie pan. One at a time, lightly coat fish filets with flour, shaking off excess. Dip each in mustard mixture coating both sides. Dip each in pretzel crumbs to coat both sides. Pressing if necessary so the coating sticks to the fish. Set each on a small cookie sheet ready to fry. In large skillet, cook fish in hot oil over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side or until golden and fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon slices if desired. 4 servings. ; name: mustard dill pretzel dip ; ingredients: sugar, olive oil, mayonnaise, stone ground mustard, prepared mustard, garlic powder, dill weed ; preparation:

name: pear and blue cheese pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, vegetable oil, salt, black pepper, pears, butter, green peppercorn, blue cheese ; preparation:Brush chops lightly with oil. Season with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, cook chops 4-5 minutes per side or until juices run clear. Remove chops from the skillet and keep warm. In the skillet used to cook the pork, cook the pear slices in the butter for 1 minute, stirring gently to coat. Stir in peppercorns. Cook and stir about 2 minutes. Spoon pears over the chops. Sprinkle with blue cheese and serve. ; name: baby greens pear walnut and blue cheese salad ; ingredients: lemon juice, dijon mustard, shallot, fresh thyme, olive oil, mixed baby greens, pears, blue cheese, walnuts ; preparation:Whisk first 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend. Gradually whisk in oil. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. Toss greens in large bowl with enough dressing to coat. Divide greens among 6 plates. Top with pear slices, dividing equally. Sprinkle with cheese and walnuts. Drizzle lightly with remaining dressing and serve. ; name: ham and hot fruit salad ; ingredients: ham steaks, pineapple, apricot halves, pear halves in natural juice, peach halves in syrup, butter, curry powder, brown sugar, cornstarch ; preparation:Place ham steaks in a casserole dish. Combine all the drained fruits and pour over the ham steaks. Melt the butter and curry powder together until bubbly and add the brown sugar and corn starch. Drizzle this evenly over the ham and fruit. Cover with foil and bake at 350f for 1 hour. The ham steaks can be omitted and the fruit used as a hot fruit salad on its own. ; name: baby greens with mustard vinaigrette ; ingredients: eggs, honey dijon mustard, white pepper, salt, red wine vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, butter lettuce ; preparation:Peel and chop eggs. Combine next 5 ingredients and process until smooth with a hand held blender. Place lettuce in a bowl, add dressing and eggs and toss gently. Serve on a plate or salad bowl. Garnish with chopped parsley. ; name: broccoli salad with bacon ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, red onion, sunflower seeds, raisins, fresh mushrooms, mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, sugar, bacon ; preparation:Clean and cut the whole broccoli into small pieces. Use all of the broccoli except the end chunks. Mix together broccoli, onion, sunflower seeds, raisins and mushrooms. Make the dressing by mixing the mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar. Twenty minutes before serving the salad, toss and then toss again with the bacon and the dressing. ; name: panera bread s bistro steak salad ; ingredients: greens, romaine lettuce, balsamic vinaigrette, gorgonzola, walnuts, steak ; preparation:Grill the seasoned steak filets. Combine the field greens and romaine. Add the dressing and toss with tongs. Mound the lettuce mixture on a serving plate. Evenly distribute the walnuts over the top of the lettuce. Sprinkle gorgonzola evenly over the salad. Place the seasoned steak filets on top. Serve with warm bread. ; name: green bean salad with radishes and prosciutto ; ingredients: green beans, radishes, prosciutto, sherry wine, dijon mustard, fresh chives, olive oil, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook beans in a large pot of salted water until crisp-tender, about 4-5 minutes. Drain well and cool. Whisk sherry, mustard, and chives, then gradually whisk in the oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss beans, radishes, and prosciutto, then toss with enough dresing to coat. Using a vegetable peeler, shave parmesan or reggiatto on top of salad. ; name: field greens with roasted bacon wrapped pears ; ingredients: bacon, pears, mixed salad greens, pecans, parmesan cheese, vinaigrette ; preparation:

name: french toast strata ; ingredients: french bread, cream cheese, eggs, half-and-half cream, butter, maple syrup ; preparation:Grease a 9x13x2 rectangular baking dish. Place half the bread cubes in the dish. Sprinkle with cream cheese cubes and then remaining bread cubes. Combine eggs, cream, melted butter and syrup. Mix well and pour over bread and cheese cubes. Using a spatula, press layers down to moisten. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours, or overnight. Remove plastic wrap and bake uncovered for 35- 40 minutes at 350f, or until set and golden brown. Let stand about 10 minutes before cutting. Top with your favorite syrup, or apple cider syrup, or a big dollop of whipped cream. ; name: baked eggplant melt sandwich ; ingredients: unseasoned breadcrumbs, fresh basil, parmesan cheese, salt, egg, eggplants, olive oil, buns, pasta sauce, part-skim mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Combine breadcrumbs, basil, parmesan and salt in shallow bowl. Whisk egg in another shallow bowl and dip eggplant slices, then coat each slice in the breadcrumb mixture. Place eggplant on parchment paper-lined baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil and bake for 15 minutes. Transfer baked eggplant to clean plate and discard parchment paper. Set toasted buns halves, cut side down, on baking sheet. Divide eggplant slices evenly among bun halves, spoon on sauce and top with cheese. Place under broiler for 2 minutes until cheese is bubbling. ; name: make ahead breakfast ; ingredients: sausage, bread, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, salt, mustard ; preparation:Brown sausage in skillet and drain well. Grease 13 x 9 inch casserole dish. Line dish with bread, then top with cheese and sausage. In bowl, combine eggs, milk, and seasonings. Beat well and pour into casserole. Refrigerate overnight. In the morning, bake casserole at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: south of the border strata ; ingredients: white bread, monterey jack cheese, green chili, ham, milk, eggs, green onions, tabasco sauce, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Spray 9x13 inch casserole dish. Place bread on bottom and top with monterey jack cheese, green chiles and ham. Mix eggs, milk, green onion& tabasco and pour over bread. Top with cheese and cover over night. Bake 325 for 40 minutes. ; name: bacon and cheese toast ; ingredients: egg, milk, baking powder, cheese, bread, bacon ; preparation:Beat egg. Add milk, baking powder and cheese. Mix well and spread on bread slices. Place a strip of bacon on top. Place under broiler and cook until golden brown. ; name: bacon egg and cheese biscuit casserole ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, butter, milk, eggs, bacon, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Start frying bacon or sausage. Combine first 5 ingredients, then cut in butter. Make a well in the center and pour in milk. Stir until well combined and moist. Turn dough out onto floured surface and knead until dough holds together well and is pliable. Press into bottom of a greased 9 x 13 pan. Beat the eggs with a splash of milk and pour over biscuit crust. Sprinkle crumbled bacon or sausage over the egg mixture and top with cheese. Bake for 16 - 20 minutes, or until egg is cooked through. ; name: chicken egg pie ; ingredients: crescent roll dough, cheddar cheese, bacon, cooked ham, eggs, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:Unroll crescent dough. Separate into triangles. Arrange in a greased 9 inch pie plate, forming crust. Seal seams and perforations. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese, bacon and ham. In a bowl, beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour over the ham. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Cover edges of crust loosely with foil. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 20 minutes longer or until a knife inserted comes out clean. ; name: peppy egg strata ; ingredients: white bread, jalapeno jack cheese, cheddar cheese, bacon, eggs, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: speedy scallops with corn and sweet peppers ; ingredients: butter, garlic cloves, onion, orange bell pepper, sweet corn, red wine, chicken broth, salt, ground black pepper, sea scallops ; preparation:Pre-heat skillet with 1 tbs butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onion. Saute about 2 minutes. Add bell pepper and saute about 5 minutes. Add corn and saute about 3 minutes. Add wine, broth, salt and pepper and simmer until most of the liquid is evaporated, about 4 minutes. Remove vegetable mixture from pan and place on serving plates. Cover to keep warm. Add remaining butter to pan. When butter is melted add scallops. Saute until slightly golden and cooked thoroughly. Serve scallops on top of corn mixture. ; name: coriander chutney broiled fish ; ingredients: white fish fillets, garlic cloves, coriander leaves, hot green peppers, whole cumin seed, chopped coconut, ground turmeric, lemon juice, oil, salt ; preparation:Pat fish dry and set aside. Make a paste of all the other ingredients. Apply thickly on the fish on both sides. Broil for 10 minutes on either side. Serve very hot, straight from the oven. ; name: lime salmon fillets ; ingredients: salmon fillets, dried thyme, salt, ground black pepper, butter, green onions, lime zest, lime ; preparation:Sprinkle the side of salmon fillets without skin with thyme, salt and pepper. In a skillet, melt butter at medium-high heat. Add salmon fillets, skin side up, and cook for about 4 minutes or until the bottom of fillets is lightly golden. Flip the salmon fillets and sprinkle with green onions and lime zest. Keep on cooking for 3 to 6 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with quarters of lime. ; name: grilled yellowtail tuna and pineapple salsa ; ingredients: yellowtail fish fillets, kosher salt, cracked black pepper, pineapple, red onion, red bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, salt & pepper ; preparation:Season yellowtail with salt & pepper on both sides, and place on hot grill. Grill to medium, as overcooking will lead to a dry finished product. While fish is cooking, place all ingredients for the pineapple salsa in a bowl and toss. When the fish is cooked, place a piece of banana leaf on the plate. Place fish on top of banana leaf and top with pineapple salsa, serve with rice and garnish with a grilled lemon. Salsa can be made 1-2 hours in advance, no need to chill. ; name: potted kippers ; ingredients: kippered herring fillets, shallot, anchovy fillets, fresh lemon juice, cayenne pepper, olive oil, scotch, unsalted butter, fresh dill sprig ; preparation:In a food processor puree the kippers with the shallot, the anchovies, lemon juice and the cayenne. With the motor running add the olive oil in a stream. Add the scotch and the butter cubes. Blend the mixture until it is combined well. Pack the mixture into small ramekins or a crock, and chill it, covered until it is firm, preferrably at least overnight. Garnish the potted kippers with the fresh dill. ; name: flounder with white wine sauce ; ingredients: flounder fillets, salt, black pepper, white wine, butter, lemon juice, capers, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut 4 pieces of aluminum foil twice the size of each fillet. Place each fillet on a piece of foil. Sprinkle fish evenly with salt and pepper. Top each with 1 tablespoon wine, 1 tablespoon butter, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon capers, and 1 teaspoon parsley. Wrap fish in foil grill for 6 to minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. ; name: broiled salmon with chili glaze ; ingredients: garlic cloves, onion, ancho chilies, light brown sugar, cider vinegar, salmon fillets, cilantro ; preparation:Blacken the whole garlic and onion slices on all sides in a large, dry non-stick frying pan. Remove, cool briefly, then peel the garlic cloves. Soak the ancho chili in boiling water for 15 mins, drain then place in a blender with the sugar, vinegar, garlic, onion and some salt and pepper. Whizz to a smooth sauce. Heat the broiler. Brush each salmon fillet liberally with the sauce and save any remaining. Broil for 8 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve with the remaining sauce. ; name: fish fillet and scallops in green peppercorn sauce ; ingredients: fresh boneless fish fillets, butter, lemon rind, scallops, green peppercorn, lemon juice, salt and black pepper ; preparation:

name: peanut butter chip chocolate cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, cocoa, baking soda, salt, peanut butter chips ; preparation:Cream butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Add flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Mix well. Stir in peanut butter chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 10 minutes. ; name: very good and yummy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, splenda granular, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla flavoring, almond flour, baking soda, salt, mini chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Grease cookie sheets. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, splenda and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well with each addition, then stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually stir into the creamed mixture. Finally, fold in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until light brown. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. ; name: delicious soft chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking soda, chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together butter and sugars until creamy. Add egg and vanilla. Blend well. In another bowl combine flour, cornstarch and baking soda. Add to butter mixture and then add chocolate chunks. Drop by tablespoons onto a greased baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes, until golden brown around the edges. ; name: chocolate chip and peanut cookies ; ingredients: butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, egg, vanilla, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, semisweet chocolate piece, peanuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Cream butter and sugars. Add egg, vanilla, and beat until light and fluffy. Sift together flour, salt and baking soda. Stir into creamed mixture. Blend well. Add chocolate pieces and peanuts and stir by hand. Drop from teaspoon about 2 inches apart on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in 375f oven for 12 minutes. Remove from sheet immediately. ; name: soft and yummy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, white sugar, egg, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream margarine. Add gradually and beat in brown sugar and white sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift and stir in flour, salt, baking soda. Add chocolate chips. Bake 10 minutes at 375. ; name: chocolate chewy cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, unsifted flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: big and chewy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: light brown sugar, white sugar, margarine, eggs, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream together sugars and margarine until fluffy with mixer. Blend in eggs, 1 at a time. Blend in vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Add flour, combining with a spoon. Add chocolate chips. Use an ice cream scoop for measurement and place on shiny cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for 18-20 minutes or until golden. ; name: chocolate chip cookies 10 ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, granulated sugar, brown sugar, unsalted butter, egg yolks, vanilla extract, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: chocolate cherry ice cream pie ; ingredients: magic shell ice cream topping, graham cracker crust, maraschino cherries, vanilla ice cream, peanut butter cups ; preparation:Following package directions, drizzle half of the ice cream topping over the crust. Gently spread to coat bottom and sides. Freeze until firm. Meanwhile, set aside six cherries for garnish. Chop remaining cherries. In a large bowl, combine ice cream and chopped cherries. Spread into prepared crust. Sprinkle with peanut butter cups. Drizzle with remaining ice cream topping. Garnish with reserved cherries. Cover and freeze for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving. ; name: blueberry cheesecake pie ; ingredients: graham cracker pie crust, cream cheese, sugar, eggs, blueberry pie filling, non-dairy whipped topping ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. Combine cream cheese, sugar and eggs in a small bowl. Beat until fluffy. Place crust on baking sheet. Pour mixture into crust. Bake 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool. Spread blueberry filling on top. Garnish with whipped topping. Chill 3 hours. ; name: chocolate cherry pie ; ingredients: graham crackers, cream cheese, sugar, cocoa, egg, almond extract, cool whip, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Add cocoa and mix well. Add egg and almond extract. Mix well. Pour filling into crust. Bake for 35 minutes. Cool completely, then spread an even layer of cool whip over pie, then top with cherry pie filling. Refrigerate 2-3 hours before serving. ; name: no bake creamy coconut pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, milk, flaked coconut, whipped topping, almond extract, graham cracker crust ; preparation:Combine cream cheese, sugar, milk and coconut in blender. Blend at medium speed for 30 seconds. Fold into whipped topping. Add extract, spoon into crust. Freeze for about 4 hours. Sprinkle with additional coconut, toasted, if desired. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes before serving. Store in freezer. ; name: strawberry cheesecake pie ; ingredients: 9-inch graham cracker crusts, fat-free evaporated milk, fat free cream cheese, egg, granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, lemon, rind of, fresh strawberries, strawberry jelly ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Place evaporated milk, cream cheese, egg, sugar, flour and lemon peel in blender, cover. Blend until smooth, pour into crust. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Arrange strawberries on top of pie. Drizzle with jelly. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving. ; name: cherry cheesecake low fat ; ingredients: eggs, low-fat cream cheese, low fat cottage cheese, nonfat dry milk powder, sugar substitute, lemon juice, pure vanilla extract, reduced fat graham cracker crust, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix first 7 ingredients by hand or in blender. Pour into pie crust, bake 30 minutes until set. Remove and refrigerate overnight. Spread cherry pie filling on top, serve. ; name: creamy lemon cheesecake pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, sour cream, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest, eggs, graham cracker pie crust ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees. Beat cream cheese in bowl with electric mixer on medium, until creamy. Add sugar and beat until well blended. Add sour cream, lemon juice and lemon peel. Mix well. Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition just until blended. Pour batter into pie shell. Bake at 325 degrees for 35- 40 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool completely on wire rack. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. ; name: no bake cherry cheesecake pie ; ingredients: prepared graham cracker crust, cream cheese, sugar, frozen dessert topping, cherry pie filling ; preparation:

name: orzo with roasted red peppers asparagus ; ingredients: orzo pasta, asparagus, roasted red peppers, margarine, garlic cloves, garlic salt, basil, thyme, oregano, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Cook orzo according to package directions. Heat skillet over medium heat. Spray with non stick cooking spray. Add earth balance margarine and garlic and cook until fragrant. Add chopped roasted red peppers and spices to taste. Reduce heat to low, add chopped asparagus and stir to coat. Drain orzo, reserving about 1 cup of the pasta cooking liquid. Add orzo to skillet, and gently mix, adding pasta water as needed. ; name: vegetable orzo side dish ; ingredients: orzo pasta, onions, oil, green pepper, red pepper, squash, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, margarine, onion soup mix ; preparation:Cook and drain orzo. Saute onions in oil for ten minutes, until translucent. Add peppers and squash. Saute until tender. Add mushrooms and bamboo shoots and cook until all vegetables are soft. Add margarine, soup mix, and orzo. Mix well. Cook for fifteen minutes or bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: orzo with parsley and lemon ; ingredients: orzo pasta, coarse salt, olive oil, lemons, zest of, black pepper, parsley ; preparation:Cook orzo in salted water 12 min, to al dente. Drain well, but do not rinse. Transfer to a serving bowl. Drizzle with oil, and season with salt and pepper. Toss with zest and parsley, and serve. ; name: greek rice with cabbage and tomatoes lahanorizo ; ingredients: cabbage, olive oil, white onion, parsley, salt, black pepper, long grain rice, tomatoes, water ; preparation:Over low heat in a large skillet, saut onion until just translucent. Increase heat to medium and add cabbage. Continue cooking until wilted. Add tomatoes and water. When in comes to a boil, add rice, parsley, salt and pepper. Reduce heat to simmer, cover and cook until very little liquid remains and rice is tender. Serve. ; name: kritharaki me rize greek orzo and rice pilaf ; ingredients: orzo, butter, rice, vegetable stock, cheese ; preparation:Saute orzo in butter in a medium saucepan, until lightly brown. Add rice, stir to coat with the butter. Add stock. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer, cover and cook for 25 minutes. Serve on a platter with grated kefalotiri cheese if desired. ; name: orzo risotto ; ingredients: butter, garlic, orzo pasta, lipton recipe secrets onion soup mix, water, milk, frozen peas, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a 3-quart saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat and cook garlic until almost golden. Add the orzo and stir until coated with butter. Stir in onion soup mix that has been blended with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered 8 minutes. Stir in milk and peas and simmer, stirring frequently, until heated through, about 1 minute. Stir in the cheese. Serve immediately. Makes about 4 cups. ; name: creamy rice with peas and mushrooms ; ingredients: onion, italian dressing, fresh mushrooms, chicken broth, frozen peas, quick-cooking rice, cream cheese, lemon peel, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook and stir onion in dressing in large saucepan on medium-high heat for 2 minutes or until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, or until mushrooms are tender. Add broth and peas. Stir. Bring to boil. Stir in rice and cream cheese. Cover. Remove from heat. Let stand 8 minutes. Stir in lemon peel and parmesan cheese. Garnish with lemon slices and fresh dill, if desired. ; name: copycat sizzler rice ; ingredients: orzo pasta, butter, chicken bouillon powder, garlic powder, onion powder, long-grain rice, lemon juice, warm water ; preparation:

name: bell pepper cole slaw no mayonnaise ; ingredients: green cabbage, red cabbage, carrot, green pepper, sugar, red wine vinegar, water, coarse salt, black pepper ; preparation:Combine the green cabbage, red cabbage, carrot and green pepper in a large bowl. Combine sugar, vinegar and water. Whisk. Salt and pepper the slaw. Pour wet ingredients over the slaw. Toss well to coat. Cover and chill at least 1 hour. ; name: spicy hot cole slaw ; ingredients: cabbage, green pepper, red pepper, onion, salt, sugar, oil, vinegar, cold water, jalapenos ; preparation:Dice cabbage, green pepper, red pepper, jalapenos, and onion. Place in large bowl. In small bowl mix together salt, sugar, oil, vinegar, and water. Mix well. Pour over cabbage, peppers, and onions and mix thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Before serving, mix well. ; name: sugar free sweet cole slaw ; ingredients: coleslaw, diced onions, light salad dressing, vegetable oil, sugar substitute, white vinegar, salt ; preparation:Combine the coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together the salad dressing, vegetable oil, sugar substitute, vinegar, and salt in a medium bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour dressing mixture over coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Chill at least 2 hours before serving. ; name: jamaican coleslaw ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, walnuts, mayonnaise, sugar, cider vinegar, jamaican jerk spice ; preparation:Combine the cabbage, carrots, and nuts in a large bowl. Set aside. Mix togerther the remaining ingredients and spoon over the cabbage mixture. Toss well. Cover and chill before serving. ; name: coleslaw for low carb diets ; ingredients: mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, sugar substitute, green cabbage, celery seed, salt substitute, ground black pepper ; preparation:Thinly slice cabbage with knife. Cut shreds into 1-inch pieces. Put in bowl. Add all other ingredients and stir to mix well. Chill. Stir before serving. ; name: freezer coleslaw ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, green pepper, salt, wine vinegar, sugar, celery seed, mustard seeds ; preparation:Mix veggies with salt. Let stand one hour. Squeeze out juice. Set aside. Boil vinegar, sugar and seeds. Cool. Mix with veggies. Put into small freezer proof containers. ; name: christmas coleslaw ; ingredients: green cabbage, red cabbage, dried sweetened cranberries, green onion, canola oil, frozen orange juice concentrate, salt, ground black pepper, cilantro ; preparation:Combine cabbages, cranberries and onions in a large bowl. Whisk together oil, juice, salt and pepper. Stir in cilantro. Pour over cabbage mixture and toss.
