Now mix this with the cooked and drained macaroni, pour it in a baking dish, sprinkle with crumbs, and bake at 350 till set, about 25 minutes. ; name: kid friendly tuna noodle casserole ; ingredients: spaghetti noodles, condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, tuna in water, onion, garlic cloves, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine mushroom soup, milk, tuna, onions, garlic and cheddar cheddar cheese. Toss with cooked pasta. Transfer to greased 9-inch square casserole pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-45 minutes. ; name: best of all macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, egg, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper, basil ; preparation:Combine egg, cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cooked pasta and mix together. Place in any casserole dish. Cook at 350 degrees for a half an hour. Sprinkle with basil for extra flavor. ; name: kid s macaroni cheese casserole ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, cheddar cheese, breadcrumbs, tuna fish, potato chips ; preparation:

name: layered lettuce salad ; ingredients: lettuce, celery, hardboiled egg, frozen peas, green pepper, sweet onion, bacon, mayonnaise, sugar, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Tear the cleaned crisp lettuce into small bite sized pieces and place in the bottom of 9x12 inch cake pan. Layer the rest of the ingredients in the order given, do not cook peas. Add the sugar to the mayonnaise and spread over the top as you would frosting. Top with grated cheese. Cover and refrigerate for 8 to 10 hours. Bacon bits can be used for bacon. ; name: green and white salad ; ingredients: cooked bacon, fresh broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, celery, onion, low-fat sour cream, low-fat mayonnaise, garlic powder, salt ; preparation:Cover bacon with paper towel and microwave 2-3 minutes to crisp. Cool. Rinse broccoli and cauliflower. Drain well. Break or chop florets into bite sized pieces. Place florets in bowl. Add celery and onion to the other vegetables. In bowl mix sour cream, mayonnaise, garlic powder, and salt. Pour dressing over vegetables. Crumble bacon over the top. Toss to mix well. Serve at once, or refrigerate up to 24 hours before serving. ; name: zippy egg salad ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, prepared horseradish, salt, fresh ground black pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:With an egg slicer, slice eggs into rounds and place in a bowl. Fold in remaining ingredients until well combined. If needed, add more mayo until desired consistancy. Adjust flavors as desired. Great on whole wheat or egg bread with lettuce. ; name: tuna noodle salad my way ; ingredients: egg noodles, tuna in water, green onion, hard-boiled eggs, mayonnaise, season salt, ground pepper, dill relish, celery ; preparation:Boil water in a 5 quart pan and cook egg noodles to al dente. Drain and let cool. Drain tuna and combine with onion, celery mayonnaise, dill pickle relish add chopped boiled eggs. Mix well. Add season salt and ground pepper and mix well. Taste. Add more seasoning or mayonnaise to your liking. Best if chilled for at least 1 hour. Serve cold. ; name: different but delicious chicken salad for parties ; ingredients: pineapple juice, lemon pepper seasoning, boneless skinless chicken breasts, almonds, garlic powder, mayonnaise ; preparation:Poach chicken breasts in pineapple juice with plenty of lemon pepper seasoning until cooked through and the poaching liquid has thickened into a partial glaze. Discard the poaching liquid and allow the chicken to cool. Run the chicken breasts through a food processor until crumbly and then pour into a large bowl. Run almonds through the food processor until coarsely or finely chopped. Add almonds to chicken. Now add garlic powder to the mix -- the more the better. Do not be afraid that you will overpower the chicken salad as the garlic powder is what makes the dish so addictive. Add mayo to desired consistency. Serve chicken salad with croissants, toasted french bread slices or a bread of your choice. ; name: lettuce and egg salad ; ingredients: red leaf lettuce, hard-boiled eggs, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, onions, dill, salt, pepper ; preparation:Clean any yellow leaves from the lettuce. Wash the lettuce very well and cut in pieces. Drain well. Chop the onion and dill. Peel the eggs and cut in medium size pieces, cutting 1 egg in round slices. Mix the lettuce, eggs, onion and dill in a glass bowl. Lay the egg slices on top. Whisk together oil and lemon juice. Drizzle over salad. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: bacon and chipotle potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, salt, sour cream, mayonnaise, pepper sauce, dijon mustard, garlic, bacon, hard-cooked eggs ; preparation:Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Add 2 teaspoons salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook 12 to 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain and cool. Meanwhile in a small bowl, combine sour cream, mayonaise, tabasco sauce, mustard and garlic. Mix well. Place potaotes in a large bowl with bacon and eggs. Add dressing and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt. Cover and refrigerate. ; name: eggless salad vegan or vegetarian ; ingredients: extra firm tofu, vegan mayonnaise, celery, onions, dijon mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: garlic lime shrimp ; ingredients: butter, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, white sugar, lime peel, cayenne, shrimp, parsley ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium-heave skillet over medium heat. Mix in the next six ingredients. Saut for 30 seconds and add shrimp. Saut shrimp until they are opaque in centre, about 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Stir in parsley and serve over rice or pasta. ; name: broiled shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, olive oil, garlic, parsley, crushed red pepper flakes, oregano, salt and pepper, fresh breadcrumbs ; preparation:Preheat broiler. Put shrimp in lg. Bowl. Add all other ingredients. Toss well to coat shrimp. Place on shallow baking sheet. Broil 7 in from heat for about 6-7 min, turning once. Serve with sauce from pan. Add a little butter if you like. ; name: sauteed shrimp with lemon and garlic ; ingredients: lemons, large shrimp, garlic, olive oil, kosher salt, pepper ; preparation:Peel, devein and rinse shrimp. Set aside. Grate the zest of both lemons, then juice both lemons. Keep zest and juice separate. In a large bowl, place shrimp then add lemon zest, garlic and half of the olive oil. Toss well to coat evenly and season with the salt and pepper. Heat remaining oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Saute shrimp in single layer for about 1 minute on each side until cooked through. After all shrimp is cooked and removed from pan, deglaze pan with 3 t of lemon juice, stirring up any browned bits. Pour sauce over shrimp and serve. ; name: garlic shrimp with basil tomatoes ; ingredients: grape tomatoes, fresh basil, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, olive oil, raw shrimp, garlic ; preparation:If using larger than cherry or grape tomatoes, cut them in segments about the same size as your shrimp. In a medium bowl, combine tomatoes & basil. Season with salt & pepper. Set aside. Rinse, drain & pat shrimp dry. Season with salt & pepper. Heat a large saute pan or skillet over medium heat. When hot, add shrimp and saute for about 1 minute. Add garlic, and continue to saute shrimp until pink and cooked through. Add shrimp and garlic to bowl of tomatoes & basil, and toss well. May be served hot. ; name: peppered shrimp ; ingredients: butter, shrimp, salt, garlic, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a glass baking dish, melt the butter in the oven. Remove the dish from the oven and add the salt, garlic and black pepper. Meanwhile, wash the shrimp, leaving the shells on. Add the shrimp to the butter mixture and stir well to coat. Bake for 15-18 minutes. ; name: baked shrimp in lemony garlic sauce ; ingredients: large shrimp, cooking spray, fresh lemon juice, light butter, garlic cloves, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper seasoning, ground red pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Arange shrimp in a single layer in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine lemon juice with butter, garlic, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper, and red pepper. Pour mixture over shrimp. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 8 to 10 minutes or until shrimp are done. Sprinkle parsley over shrimp. Serve immediately. Serving size is 3 ounces shrimp with 2 tablespoons sauce with 3 points per serving. ; name: ed s south of the border marinated shrimp ; ingredients: fresh shrimp, limes, red onion, garlic cloves, olive oil, fresh jalapenos, cilantro, sugar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to boil and add the shrimp. Bring to a boil again and cook for 3 minutes. Drain the shrimp and rinse to stop the cooking. Peel as soon as the shrimp are cool enough to handle. Mince the onion, garlic, and jalapenos, chop the cilantro and add to the olive oil in a large bowl. Squeeze the limes and add to the bowl along with the shrimp and sugar, salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for a few hours. Serve with toothpicks and plenty of napkins. ; name: garlic lover s shrimps ; ingredients: olive oil, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, raw shrimp, salt, dry sherry, fresh parsley, old bay seasoning ; preparation:

name: bread pudding for 2 ; ingredients: challah, golden raisins, eggs, nonfat milk, brown sugar, vanilla, ground cinnamon, salt, butter ; preparation:Spray two 6 to 7 oz ramekins with non-stick cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cube bread and measure out 1 cup of cubes, place cubes in prepared ramekins and divided the raisins or blueberries between the two. In a small dish, beat together the milk, egg or egg substitute, stir in brown sugar, cinnamon and vanilla. Mixing well. Pour the mixture evenly over the bread cubes and drizzle with melted butter. Place on a cookie sheet, just in case it cooks over, and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes our clean. Serve warm. ; name: old fashioned chocolate pudding ; ingredients: white sugar, cornstarch, cocoa, milk, margarine, vanilla ; preparation:In a sauce pan combine sugar, cornstarch and cocoa. Slowly add milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat and continue. Stirring until thick. Remove from heat and add margarine and vanilla. ; name: french pudding ; ingredients: vanilla wafers, margarine, powdered sugar, eggs, crushed pineapple, whipping cream, granulated sugar, pecans ; preparation:Line a 9x13-inch glass dish with vanilla wafers. Melt margarine in a saucepan. Add powdered sugar. Beat eggs into margarine mixture gradually. Pour over wafers. Spread pineapple over sauce. Whip cream and sweeten with granulated sugar to taste. Spread over pineapple layer. Sprinkle with pecans. Chill for several hours. ; name: french vanilla bread pudding for 2 ; ingredients: cinnamon-raisin bread, egg, non-dairy coffee creamer, caramels, pecans, cinnamon, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Place the bread cubes in two greased 6-oz. Custard cups. In a small bowl, whisk the egg and creamer. Pour over the bread. Sprinkle with the caramel pieces, nuts, and cinnamon and dot with butter. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Cool slightly before serving. ; name: chocolate banana bread puddings ; ingredients: unsalted butter, brown sugar, bananas, milk, eggs, pure vanilla extract, white bread, milk chocolate candy bars ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350. Line 12 muffin tins with paper or foil liners. In a nonstick skillet, melt the butter with the brown sugar over moderately high heat. Add the banana slices and cook, turning once, until caramelized, about 3 minutes. The bananas shold be softened and sticky. Remove from the heat and let cool. In a large bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, and vanilla. Stack the toasted bread, slice off the crusts and cut the bread into 4 triangles. Add the bread to the custard and let soack unti the custard is absorbed, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cooled caramelized bananas and the chocolate. Spoon the mixture into the prepared muffin cups. Bake the puddings until puffy and golden, about 25 minutes. ; name: pudding au chomeur ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, milk, light brown sugar, boiling water, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Mix first 3 ingredients. Then add the milk. Pour into ungreased 9x13 pan. Mix final 4 ingredients. Let butter melt. Pour over back of wooden spoon over cake batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: rutabaga pudding irish ; ingredients: rutabaga, fine breadcrumbs, milk, butter, salt, sugar, egg ; preparation:Clean, peel and cube the rutabaga, and cook in boiling water until tender, then drain. Mash thoroughly. Then add all the other ingredients. Put into a 2-quart casserole and bake at 350f for 1 hour. A pinch of cinnamon or ginger might be added. ; name: irish bread and butter pudding ; ingredients: dry white bread, sweet butter, nutmeg, golden raisin, eggs, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, superfine sugar, white sugar ; preparation:

name: garlicky potato puffs ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, garlic cloves, potato starch, salt, fresh ground black pepper, eggs, parsley, paprika ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 400f. Add the minced garlic to the melted butter and allow to stand until needed. Peel, dice, and boil potatoes till tender. Mash with a potato masher. Add all ingredients to the potatoes and mix well. Place large tablespoons of the mixture in a buttered baking dish or on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle each with paprika, if desired. Bake in the oven for about 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown. ; name: roasted glazed sweet potatoes with apples ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, apples, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, butter, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. On a baking sheet with sides, toss sweet potatoes and apples with oil, salt and pepper. Spread out into single layer. Roast 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, stir together butter, brown sugar and pumpkin pie spices. Spoon over potato mixture and toss to coat. Continue baking for 10 minutes or until sugar has melted. ; name: chili roasted sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, olive oil, sugar, chili powder, kosher salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Cut each potato lengthwise into 8 wedges. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss potatoes with oil, sugar, chili powder, salt, and ground pepper, until coated. Place sweet potatoes, cut sides down, on baking sheet. Roast potatoes until browned and tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Season with additional salt, if desired, before serving. ; name: grandma s potato puffs ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, flour, baking powder, salt, eggs, oil, maple syrup ; preparation:Beat egg yolks until creamy. Add mashed potatoes and mix well. Sift flour, salt and baking powder. Add flour mixture to potatoes. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold egg whites into mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls into hot grease or oil. Serve with syrup while hot. ; name: really really good candied sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, maple syrup, brown sugar, cinnamon ; preparation:Cover potatoes with water, bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 25 minutes, until done. When cooled, peel and cut into chunks. Place in 2-qt baking dish. In small saucepan combine remaining ingredients, cook and stir until mixture boils. Pour over potatoes. Bake at 350f for 40 minutes. ; name: roasted sweet potatoes potatoes and carrots ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, potatoes, baby carrots, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, oregano, rosemary, bulb of garlic, black pepper ; preparation:Peel and cut in bite size pieces all the vegetable. Peel and squash the garlic but do not cut it. Mix the vegetables, garlic and all remaining. Ingredients. Spread on a parchemin lined pan. Broil until nice and golden about half an hour. ; name: baked sweet potato with topping ; ingredients: sweet potato, pure maple syrup, raisins, sunflower seeds, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Foil line baking sheet. Prick potato with fork. Place on baking sheet and bake one hour or until very tender. Split sweet potato and top with remaining ingredients. Try eight minutes, rotating potato after four for even cooking. ; name: sweet potato puffs ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, milk, salt, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, blanched slivered almond ; preparation:

name: potato leek and quinoa soup ; ingredients: leeks, onion, potatoes, quinoa, swanson vegetable broth, olive oil ; preparation:Slice leek and rinse well. Peel and cube potato. Peel and chop onion. Turn slow cooker on high to preheat. Saute leek, onion and potato in olive oil on stove. Add stock and bring to a boil. Add quinoa and return to boil. Transfer to slow cooker. Cook on low 5-6 hours. ; name: leek cream soup ; ingredients: leeks, cauliflower, onion, vegetable bouillon granules, cream, salt and pepper, parsley ; preparation:Cut the leek in small pieces. Cut the center out of the cauliflower and separate the flowerets. Cook the leek, onion and cauliflower in the vegetable bouillon until soft. With the mixer, mix the soup until smooth. Heat again, stirring the cream in. Serve with the parsley sprinkled on top. ; name: baked leeks with cheese and yogurt ; ingredients: butter, leeks, eggs, fresh goat cheese, plain yogurt, parmesan cheese, fresh white breadcrumbs, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a shallow ovenproof dish. Trim the leeks, cut a slit from the top to bottom and rinse well under cold water. Place the leeks in a saucepan of water, brind to a boil, and simmer gently for 6-8 minutes, until just tender. Remove and drain well using sloted spoon. Arrange in the prepared dish. Beat the eggs with the goat cheese, yogurt, and half the parmesan cheese. Season well with salt and pepper. Pour the cheese and yogurt mixture over the leeks. Mix the breadcrumbs with the remaining parmesan cheese, and sprinkle over the sauce. Back for 35-40 minutes, until the top is crisp and golden brown. ; name: leek onion and potato soup ; ingredients: leeks, potatoes, onion, butter, chicken stock, milk, heavy cream ; preparation:Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add leeks, onions and potatoes and stir. Cover saucepan and sweat veg for 10-15 minutes. Add stock and milk and bring to boil. Replace lid and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend the soup and return to the saucepan. Season and add cream to taste. ; name: leek and potato pie ; ingredients: potatoes, leeks, flour, salt and pepper, nutmeg, milk, butter ; preparation:Peel the potatoes and slice thinly. Wash the leeks thoroughly and slice thinly discarding about the last 2 inches of the green tops. Mix together the flour, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Grease a casserole dish. Put in alternate layers of potatoes and leeks sprinkling each layer with the seasoned flour and small chips of butter. The top layer should be potatoes. Dot the top with butter, pour hot milk on top of the casserole. Bake in the oven uncovered for about 1 hour. ; name: carrots piedmontese ; ingredients: carrot, butter, onion, garlic, salt, vinegar, chives ; preparation:Cook carrots in boiling water 3 minutes then drain. Return carrots to saucepan. Add butter, onion, garlic and salt. Cover, cook over low heat 10 minutes or until carrots are tender crisp. Discard garlic. Add vinegar. Place in serving dish and sprinkle with chives. ; name: braised celery irish ; ingredients: celery, onion, fresh parsley leaves, bacon, chicken stock, salt and black pepper, butter ; preparation:Clean celery, cut into one-inch pieces and place in a casserole dish. Finely chop bacon and onion and sprinkle over celery along with chopped parsley. Pour on stock. Dot with knobs of butter. Cover dish and bake in a moderate oven for 30-45 minutes. ; name: braised leeks ; ingredients: leeks, garlic, carrots, olive oil ; preparation:

name: broccoli and tortellini salad ; ingredients: bacon, cheese-filled tortellini, mayonnaise, white sugar, cider vinegar, fresh broccoli, raisins, sunflower seeds, red onion ; preparation:Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble and set aside. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook tortellini in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain, and rinse under cold water. In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar to make the dressing. In a large bowl, combine broccoli, tortellini, bacon, raisins, sunflower seeds and red onion. Pour dressing over salad, and toss. ; name: todd s broccoli salad ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, broccoli, baby spinach, red onion, bacon bits, dark raisin, golden raisin ; preparation:Mix mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar in a bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, mix broccoli, spinach, onion, bacon bits, and raisins. Pour the dressing over the mixture and mix thoroughly but gently. Allow at least 1 hour of refrigeration before serving. ; name: pineapple salad ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, white sugar, dry tapioca, cider vinegar, crushed pineapple, apples, unsalted peanuts, frozen whipped topping ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, stir together the flour, sugar, tapioca, vinegar, and the reserved pineapple juice. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thick. Remove from heat and chill. In a large bowl, combine the pineapple, apples, peanuts, and chilled tapioca mixture. Fold in the whipped topping and chill for at least 1 hour before serving. ; name: broccoli ramen noodle salad ; ingredients: broccoli coleslaw mix, red pepper, yellow pepper, scallions, slivered almonds, sunflower seeds, ramen noodles, balsamic vinegar, sugar, oil ; preparation:Combine the slaw, peppers, scallions, and nuts in a large bowl. Mix together vinegar, oil, sugar, and the seasoning packet from the ramen mix. Stir the dressing into the salad. Crumble the ramen noodles and add to salad. Toss the whole thing to get everything coated. ; name: spicy broccoli salad ; ingredients: broccoli florets, red bell pepper, miniature corn cobs, red onion, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, light brown sugar, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Steam broccoli florets for 2 minutes, then rinse quickly in cold water. Drain well. Place broccoli in serving bowl, adding the onions, bell peppers, and miniature corn. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil, brown sugar and red pepper flakes. Just before serving toss dressing with vegetables. Season with salt. ; name: chicken broccoli tossed salad ; ingredients: broccoli florets, romaine lettuce, chicken breasts, apple, fat-free italian salad dressing, pecan halves, golden raisins ; preparation:Cook broccoli by steaming for 5-8 minutes or until broccoli is crisp-tender. Drain broccoli and rinse in cold water. Then pat dry with paper towels. Divide romaine lettuce among four salad plates. In a bowl, combine the chicken, apple and broccoli. Drizzle with dressing and toss to coat. Spoon chicken mixture onto romaine. Sprinkle with pecans and raisins. ; name: orange pineapple salad ; ingredients: orange gelatin mix, pineapple gelatin mix, mandarin oranges, crushed pineapple, cream cheese, cool whip, sugar, nuts ; preparation:Dissolve jell-o in 2 cups boiling water. Put oranges and pineapple with their juice in jell-o. Pour mixture into a 9x13 cake pan. Refrigerate until set. Beat cream cheese and sugar. Fold in cool whip. Spread over jell-o. Garnish with nuts. ; name: pineapple raisin broccoli salad ; ingredients: bacon, broccoli florets, cheddar cheese, pineapple tidbits, raisins, red onions, mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:

name: cajun coffee ; ingredients: brewed coffee, molasses, dark rum, whipped cream, nutmeg ; preparation:Combine the coffee and molasses in a saucepan. Heat, stirring, until molasses is dissolved and coffee is very hot. Pour 1 tablespoon of rum into each of 6 mugs. Add the coffee. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with nutmeg. Do not stir before drinking. ; name: caramel bars ; ingredients: flour, oatmeal, butter, brown sugar, baking soda, salt, caramels, chocolate chips, heavy whipping cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the first six ingredients for crust. Place half of mix in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake crust for 10 minutes. Melt caramels and whipping cream. Place chocolate chips over baked crust, drizzel caramel over chips, then place the remaining crust mixture on top of the caramel. Bake another 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. ; name: coffee ricotta creams ; ingredients: raisins, rum, golden caster sugar, strong black coffee, ricotta cheese, double cream, dark chocolate, icing sugar ; preparation:In small bowl, mix together raisins, rum, sugar and 4 tablespoons of the coffee. Stir well and leave to sit for 1 hour. Lightly beat ricotta to soften. Gradually beat in raisin mixture. Whip the cream into soft peaks and fold into the ricotta with half of the chocolate. Spoon into four glasses or serving dishes, drizzle over the remaining coffee and sprinkle with remaining chocolate. Chill at least one hour and up to 4 hours. Dust lightly with icing sugar before serving. ; name: sugar and spice nuts ; ingredients: egg white, cashews, pecan halves, almonds, white sugar, ground cinnamon, cayenne pepper, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f degrees. Grease a baking sheet and set aside. Beat egg white in a large bowl with a fork or whisk until foamy. Stir in two cups of unsalted nuts until coated. Stir in sugar and spices. Toss with nuts until coated. Put nuts onto prepared baking sheet. Spread out well. Bake, stirring often, until golden-- about 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container. ; name: chocolate mug cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, cocoa, egg, milk, oil, chocolate chips, vanilla, coffee ; preparation:Add dry ingredients to mug and mix well. Add egg and mix well. Pour in milk, oil, and mix well. Add chocolate chips and vanilla and mix again. Put mug in microwave for 3 minutes on 1000 watts. The cake will rise over the top of mug, dont be alarmed. Allow to cool a bit and. ; name: lots of cinnamon coffee cake ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, egg, milk, sour cream, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Mix first 5 dry ingredients together. Beat egg, add milk, sour cream, melted butter and vanilla. Combine with dry ingredients only until blended. Pour into a greased, floured 8 or 9 inch round or square pan. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 25 minutes. ; name: coffee ganache ; ingredients: instant espresso, boiling water, heavy cream, light corn syrup, dark chocolate ; preparation:Stir together the instant espresso and boiling water until smooth. Set aside. Combine the cream and the corn syrup in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the espresso. Pour the mixture over the chocolate and let sit, covered, for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir until the chocolate is completely melted and the sauce is very smooth. Keep warm until ready to use, or let cool to room temperature and store in a container with a tight-fitting lid in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Reheat chilled sauce over very low heat on the stovetop or in the microwave until warm enough to pour easily. ; name: mexican coffee balls ; ingredients: chocolate wafers, blanched almond, unsweetened cocoa powder, white sugar, instant coffee, coffee liqueur, light corn syrup, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:

name: one pan banana bread ; ingredients: vegetable oil, bananas, vanilla extract, eggs, bisquick baking mix, sugar, nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Generously grease the bottom only of a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Stir all ingredients in pan with a fork until moistened. Beat vigorously 1 minute. Bake 55 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Run knife around sides of loaf to loosen, remove from pan. Cool completely. ; name: bananacran bread ; ingredients: bananas, frozen cranberries, butter, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Beat together butter, sugar and eggs until creamy. Add bananas and cranberries. Combine the remaining dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Add to the wet ingredients and stir until well mixed. Pour into a large greased loaf pan and bake in a 350 oven for an hour. Remove and cool for 20 minutes in the pan before removing. ; name: aidan s banana nut bread ; ingredients: salt, self raising flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, butter, sugar, eggs, bananas, nuts ; preparation:Sift together salt, flour and spices. Cream butter and sugar, then add the eggs one at a time, beating well. Beat mixture until light and fluffy. Add sifted flour and spices and bananas to creamed mixture, combining lightly. Fold in nuts. Turn the mixture into a well greased loaf tin bake in a moderate oven for 50 to 60 minutes. Cool in the tin. Can be iced with a cream cheese frosting or lemon icing. ; name: banana cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, egg, baking powder, flour, banana, chocolate chips ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 350f. Cream together margrine and brown sugar. Add egg and beat. Then add baking powder and flour. Mash banana and add chocolate chips if using. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 15 minutes ot until browned. ; name: holiday banana bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, walnuts, mixed candied fruit, raisins, butter, sugar, eggs, bananas ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Thoroughly grease a 5 x 9-inch loaf pan. Sift the flour, measure, and sift with the baking powder and salt onto a piee of waxed paper. Add the nuts, raisins and candied fruits, and mix until well coated with the flour. Cream together the butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until lthik and pale-lemon colored. Alternate additions of flour and fruit mixture and the mashed bananas, stirring after each addition until well blended. Begin and end with flour mixture. Spoon into prepared loaf pan and bake in preheated oven for about 60 minutrs or until bread pulls away from the sides of the pan. Let cool about 20 minutes before turning out on a rack to cool well. ; name: naturally sweetened banana bread ; ingredients: bananas, unsweetened applesauce, eggs, water, vanilla extract, whole wheat flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 f. Mash the bananas until they are mostly lump-free. With a hand mixer, beat together the banana, applesauce, eggs, vanilla, and water until creamy. In a separate bowl, sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and spices. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients, beating well. Pour the batter into a gently oiled and floured 95 inches loaf pan and spread evenly. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick is inserted and comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack before slicing. ; name: rum banana bread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, rum, sour cream, almond extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, mashed banana ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs and beat until light. Add rum, sour cream and almond extract. Mix in mashed bananas. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in separate bowl. Pour wet mixture into dry mixture and combine. Bake for 1 hour depending on size of loaf pan. ; name: pull apart monkey bread ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, butter, sugar, cinnamon, nuts ; preparation:

name: butter baked chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, evaporated milk, flour, salt, pepper, butter, cream of chicken soup, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Dip chicken in milk, then roll in seasoned flour. Melt butter in 9 x 13 baking dish. Place chicken, skin side down, in butter. Cook 30 minutes. Mix water, remaining milk and soup together. Turn chicken and pour soup mixture over it. Bake 30 minutes more. Remove chicken and stir gravy. ; name: killer kahlua ; ingredients: water, sugar, instant coffee, pure vanilla extract, monarch 151 rum ; preparation:Bring to boil water and sugar. Remove from heat and add instant. Coffee. Bring to boil again. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract. Cool before adding rum. Put in bottles and cork. Makes about 3 fifths. ; name: chicken kabouli interior style ; ingredients: whole chicken, salt, spices, ghee, onions, garlic cloves, chicken bouillon cubes, water, basmati rice, toasted almond ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Season chicken with the salt and 1 tablespoon of the omani spice mix. Roast chicken on a rack or in a baking dish for 45 minutes until it is cooked through and the skin has browned. Remove from oven and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the ghee, then add the onions and cook until golden, about 5 or 6 minutes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of spice mix and garlic. Add the bouillon and water. Once the mixture boils, stir in the rice. Cover, reduce heat and cook on low for about 25 minutes until rice is tender. Serve rice with chicken on top. Garnish with toasted almonds. ; name: south african chicken kurma ; ingredients: fryer chickens, oil, onion, curry powder, garlic, sugar, salt, cayenne pepper, water ; preparation:Place all ingredients into a large stock pot with a lid. Bring to a boil on high heat for 15 minutes. Lower heat to medium. Simmer for one hour. Serve over rice. ; name: karol z coleslaw ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, skim milk, light mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:Put shredded cabbage and grated carrot in a large bowl. Whisk together milk, mayo, sugar, and vinegar. Pour over cabbage. Stir well. Let chill for about an hour at least. ; name: honey glazed chicken kabobs ; ingredients: reduced-sodium soy sauce, honey, canola oil, prepared horseradish, steak seasoning, garlic cloves, boneless skinless chicken breasts, sweet red pepper, green pepper, onion ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine the first six ingredients. Pour 1 cup marinade into a large resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 5-6 hours. Cover and refrigerate remaining marinade. Drain and discard marinade. On six- eight metal or soaked wooden skewers, alternately thread chicken and vegetables. Grill, covered, over medium heat for 5-7 minutes on each side or until chicken juices run clear, basting frequently with reserved marinade. ; name: kabocha squash with sage and leeks ; ingredients: kabocha squash, butter, fresh sage, leek, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Prepare squash by washing, poking 2-4 holes into center with sharp knife. Bake whole squash in oven for 60-90 minutes, until soft. When squash is done, cut in half, remove seeds and fibers, and scrape flesh from skin into a bowl, mash but do not puree squash. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add sage leaves and fry until crisp 1-2 minutes. Add leek and salt and continue heating 2-5 minutes until leeks are soft and translucent. Now add squash to skillet and mix until all butter is incorporated. ; name: browned kohlrabi karalabe fozelek ; ingredients: kohlrabi, butter, salt, sugar, parsley, flour, chicken broth ; preparation:

name: christmas snow drop cookies ; ingredients: butter, shortening, powdered sugar, flour, vanilla, almonds ; preparation:Mix in order given. Roll into small balls, about 48, and place on lightly greased cookie sheet or parchment paper. Bake at 300 for 30 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven to cool. Cookies should not be brown but a very light tan. Roll in powdered sugar while still warm. Roll in powdered sugar again when cool. Store in an air tight container. ; name: easy cornbread 4 ingredients ; ingredients: cornmeal mix, skim milk, egg, oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. You can use butter spray to grease skillet, but it works best if you put a little oil in the skillet and put it in the oven while it is preheating. Remove skillet and tilt to coat pan bottom with oil right before you pour in the batter. Mix cornmeal, milk, egg and oil in bowl. Pour batter into hot skillet and return skillet to oven. Bake for 20-30 minutes depending on your oven. Cornbread is done when the top is nice and brown and the sides have pulled away from the pan. Turn over the pan and it should slide right out. Cut into wedges and serve hot. ; name: simple fried cornbread ; ingredients: pancake mix, white cornmeal, milk, oil ; preparation:Mix pancake mix and cornmeal. Add milk till batter is the consistency of pancakes. Heat a thin layer of oil in a skillet. When hot, drop batter into skillet as you would for pancakes. Turn when top stops bubbling. ; name: swirl frosting ; ingredients: light corn syrup, sugar, egg whites, salt, cream of tartar, vanilla ; preparation:Combine corn syrup and sugar in saucepan. Place over moderate heat and cook. Heat till sugar dissolves and bubbles appear at edge. Whip whites, salt and tartar till nearly stiff. Pour hot syrup into whites, whipping constantly. Add vanilla and whip until frosting stays in soft peaks. ; name: moist cornbread ; ingredients: white flour, cornmeal, salt, baking powder, white sugar, milk, oil, creamed corn, eggs ; preparation:Turn oven on to 300 degrees. In large bowl mix together dry ingredients, first 5 ingredients. In smaller bowl mix together wet ingredients, last 4 ingredients. Add wet ingredients to larger bowl of dry ingredients. Mix well. Grease an 8-9 inch cast iron pan with pam. Pour batter into pan and bake for 1 hour. ; name: honey sweet cornbread ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, margarine, sugar, honey, eggs, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 8x8 baking pan and set aside. Combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl and set aside. Place margarine and sugar in large bowl of mixer and cream until smooth. Add honey and eggs and beat to blend, scraping bottom and sides of bowl frequently. Beat in half of the milk. Beat in half of the flour mixture. Repeat with remaining milk and flour mixture. With mixer at lowest speed, continue to mix for 4 minutes. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in oven 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. ; name: melting moments cookies biscuits ; ingredients: butter, caster sugar, egg yolk, vanilla extract, self-raising flour, corn flakes ; preparation:Grease two baking sheets. Cream the butter and sugar together until pale and fluffy. Beat in the egg yolk. Add the vanilla flavouring, stir in the flour to give a smooth dough and divide into about 24 portions. Form each piece into a ball and roll in crushed cornflakes. Place the balls on the baking sheets and bake in the oven at 190c mark 5 for 15 - 20 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets for a few moments before lifting on to a wire rack. Variation. Instead of cornflakes, use 50 g rolled oats. Press half a glace cherry 8in the centre of each biscuit. ; name: scottish whipped shortbread ; ingredients: salted butter, icing sugar, cornstarch, flour, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: tarragon carrots and peas ; ingredients: sugar snap pea, water, carrot, butter, fresh tarragon, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, salt ; preparation:Place sugar snap peas and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add carrot and butter. Cover and cook 2 minutes. Stir in tarragon, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, and salt. Enjoy. ; name: honey pineapple glazed carrots ; ingredients: raw carrots, butter, onions, crushed pineapple, brown sugar, honey, tarragon, salt ; preparation:In a saucepan, cook carrot slices in boiling water until crisp-tender. Drain and keep hot. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt butter, and sautee the onion until soft. Add all remaining ingredients and heat through. Add cooked, drained carrot slices to sauce. Remove from heat and gently to coat. ; name: glazed carrots with onions ; ingredients: butter, carrots, onions, ground ginger, orange juice, currant jelly, salt, fresh parsley ; preparation:In a medium skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add carrots, onions, and ginger, cover and cook, stirring, for about 7 to 10 minutes, until just tender. Stir in the orange juice, jelly, and salt. Cook, uncovered, for about 4 minutes, stirring frequently, until vegetables are tender and nicely glazed with the jelly and orange juice mixture. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley just before serving. ; name: sweet and sour cabbage and carrots ; ingredients: butter, green cabbage, carrots, onion, brown sugar, reduced sodium soy sauce, cider vinegar, pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add to the skillet the cabbage, carrots, onion and brown sugar. Cook, stirring often, for about 10-12 minutes until the veggies are well-browned and softened. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce, vinegar and pepper. Serve hot. ; name: carrots for a change ; ingredients: carrots, bacon, onion, brown sugar, butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Boil carrots until barely tender. Fry bacon until crisp, then drain and crumble. Brown onion in part of the bacon grease after draining off some juice. In a buttered baking dish, combine carrots, bacon, onion, salt and pepper. Sprinkle brown sugar over top and pour melted butter all over. Bake carrots covered until thoroughly heated. ; name: glazed orange carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, butter, orange juice concentrate, brown sugar, parsley ; preparation:Cover carrots with water, bring to boil. Simmer until crisp tender. Melt butter, stir in orange juice concentrate, parsley and sugar. Pour over carrots. Cook and stir until glaze thickens. ; name: roasted carrots with lemon dressing ; ingredients: carrots, olive oil, cayenne pepper, coarse salt, honey, lemon, juice and zest of ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. In foil lined roasting pan, toss carrots with oil and cayenne and season with salt. Arrange in single layer, using two pans if needed. Roast tossing one halfway through for 30-40 minutes, or until tender. In a small bowl, whisk together honey, zest and lemon juice. Season with salt. Drizzled over carrots and toss to coat. ; name: apple cider glazed carrots ; ingredients: butter, carrot, apple cider, brown sugar, tarragon, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: chickpeas chorizo beans and sausage ; ingredients: red onions, extra virgin olive oil, red bell peppers, chorizo sausages, chickpeas, parsley, salt, pepper ; preparation:Saute onions in oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the chopped peppers and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Move the vegetables to one side of the pan. Add the sliced chorizo to the cleared space and brown on both sides. Cook chorizo for 10 minutes or until cooked through, stirring occasionally. Add chickpeas and mix together. When heated through season with the salt and pepper to taste. Serve. ; name: chinese style broccoli ; ingredients: canola oil, broccoli, low sodium soy sauce, garlic clove, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Heat oil in a large wok or high-sided skillet over med-high heat. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, garlic, and lemon juice. Continue to stir-fry until broccoli is crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: broccoli california style 1958 ; ingredients: broccoli, oil, garlic clove, onion, dried cayenne pepper, water, salt ; preparation:Heat oil in large skillet. Add garlic, onion, and pepper. Cook until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. Remove pepper and discard. Add broccoli, water and salt. Cover and simmer until tender-crisp, 12-15 minutes. ; name: french green beans sauted with mushrooms and almonds ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, button mushrooms, whole almond, frozen french-cut green beans, soy sauce ; preparation:Heat oil over medium heat. Saut garlic until soft, being careful not to let it burn. Add sliced mushrooms and saut until they look fairly cooked and shiny. Add almonds and saut for a couple more minutes. Finally, add frozen green beans and splash of soy sauce. Stir frequently until beans are just cooked and, of course, no longer frozen. If not on the south beach diet or watching sugar intake, you could add oyster sauce or other asian condiment to the mixture. ; name: green beans with pepitas raw pumpkin seeds ; ingredients: green beans, olive oil, pepitas, kosher salt, rosemary, garlic clove ; preparation:Cook green beans in pan of boiled salted water for 5 minutes. Drain and cool. Cut beans into 1-inch pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add pepitas, tossing until they pop and brown. Sprinkle with kosher salt and pepper. Green beans can be prepared 2 hours ahead to this point. Let stand at room temperature. Heat remaining oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add rosemary and garlic. Stirring for about 15 seconds or so before adding beans and pepitas. Toss until heated through. ; name: garlic broccoli spears ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Set florets into a saucepan with a very small amount of water, cover with lid, and let steam until tender, about 5-10 minutes or so- it should still be bright green, but fork tender. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Drain broccoli and place in serving dish. Pour lemon mixture over broccoli and toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: broccoli and bell peppers ; ingredients: soy sauce, lemon juice, toasted sesame oil, broccoli florets, red sweet peppers ; preparation:For sauce, in a small bowl stir together soy sauce, lemon juice and sesame oil. Set aside. Place a steamer basket in a 12 inch skillet. Add enough water to come just below bottom of basket and bring to a boil. Place broccoli in steamer basket and reduce heat to medium low. Cover and steam for 4 minutes. Add sweet peppers. Cover and steam for 3 to 4 minutes more or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Transfer vegetables to a serving bowl. Drizzle sauce over vegetables and toss gently to coat. ; name: broccoli and green bean polka ; ingredients: head of broccoli, french beans, olive oil, unsalted cashews, almonds, sea salt ; preparation:

name: molly s coconut cookies ; ingredients: oleo, brown sugar, egg, oatmeal, flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, salt, pure vanilla extract, coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven 375f. Roll in 1-inch balls. Place on greased cookie sheet. Press with fork. Bake 10-12 minutes. ; name: frosted creams ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, eggs, molasses, sour milk, baking soda, salt, flour, cinnamon ; preparation:Cream shortening and sugar well. Add beaten eggs and molasses, mixing well. Dissolve soda in sour milk and add to creamed mixture. Mix together flour, salt and cinnamon, then add to creamed mixture. Bake at 350 in greased jelly roll pan for 20-25 minutes. Cool and frost with thin powdered sugar butter icing. ; name: old farmer s almanac butterscotch icebox cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, nuts ; preparation:Cream together butter and brown sugar until light. Add egg and vanilla, and mix well. Stir together flour, salt, and baking powder and add to sugar-egg-butter mix, mixing well. Stir in nuts. Form dough into a 2-inch-diameter log and wrap in foil or waxed paper. Chill for 12 to 24 hours. Slice and bake on ungreased cookie sheets at 400 degrees f for 8 to 10 minutes. ; name: strawberry cream cheese sandwich cookies ; ingredients: cream cheese, strawberry preserves, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, vanilla wafers ; preparation:In a medium bowl, smash cream cheese with a fork. Combine the rest of the ingredients together with the cream cheese. Mix well. Let chill in the refridgerator for at least 30 minutes. On the flat side of the wafer, spread 2 tsp of mixture. Then top with another wafer to make a sandwich. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve immediately. ; name: dark chocolate cookies ; ingredients: flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients together in a bowl. Cream butter and sugar in another bowl, add eggs and vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients. Drop by tablespoonsful on ungreased cookies sheets, 2 inches apart, and bake in preheated 375 oven about 12 minutes, til tops are puffed and set. Cool on rack. ; name: strawberry cheese cake ice cream ; ingredients: cream cheese, milk, fresh lemon juice, sugar, salt, heavy cream, eggs, vanilla, strawberry ; preparation:Bring milk just to a boil in a heavy saucepan. Whisk together eggs, sugar, and salt in a bowl, then add hot milk in a slow stream, whisking. Pour custard back into saucepan and cook over moderately low heat, stirring with a wooden spoon, approx 2 to 3 minutes, the custard will coat the back of the spoon. Immediately pour custard through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl. On very low speed, blend in cream cheese until thoroughly incorporated. Stir in cream and vanilla. Place plastic wrap directly onto surface of custard mixture and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or over night. Freeze completely cooled custard in ice cream maker. When custard is nearly done, add sliced strawberries. Complete freezing process and transfer to an airtight container. Place in the freezer to cure for about two hours. Allow to stand at room temperature 5-10 minutes before serving. ; name: quick drop cookies ; ingredients: sugar, salt, butter, milk, peanut butter, rolled oats, vanilla extract, instant chocolate drink mix ; preparation:Combine sugar, salt, butter and milk in a medium size sauce pan. Bring to a boil and let boil for 1 minute. Stir in peanut butter, oats, vanilla and chocolate drink mix. Drop by rounded teaspoons full onto waxed paper. Let set until cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: easy homemade cookie ice cream paula deen ; ingredients: egg yolks, condensed milk, vanilla extract, chocolate sandwich style cookies, heavy cream ; preparation:

name: funny pie ; ingredients: sugar, butter, eggs, flour, baking cocoa, vanilla, pecans, whipped cream, chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease 8-inch pie pan. Combine sugar and butter and mix well in a large bowl. Add eggs, then flour, cocoa and vanilla, stirring well after each addition. Stir in pecans. Pour mixture into pie pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until set. Cool and garnish with whipped cream and chocolate, if desired. ; name: fresh cherry pie ; ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie, sugar, flour, salt, almond extract, tart cherries, butter ; preparation:Combine sugar, flour and salt. Add almond extract to cherries and toss with sugar flour mixture to mix well. Pour into pastry lined 9 inch pie pan. Put on top crust. Bake at 400 for about 40 minutes. If edges brown too much cover it with aluminum foil. The syrup does bubble and may spill over a little so i set the pie on a cookie sheet then baked it. ; name: raisin pie ; ingredients: eggs, vinegar, margarine, vanilla, sugar, raisins, salt ; preparation:Melt margarine. Beat eggs. Add sugar, vinegar to the eggs. Then add margarine vanilla, salt and raisins. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake 1 hour at 350. ; name: chocolate marvel pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, semi-sweet chocolate chips, sugar, milk, eggs, vanilla, whipped cream, almonds ; preparation:Melt chocolate pieces with sugar and milk in double boiler, stirring occasionally. Cool. Beat in egg yolks, one at a time. Stir in vanilla. In separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into chocolate mixture. Pour into cooled pie shell. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. If desired, garnish with whipped cream and sprinkle with roasted chopped almonds. ; name: cherry pie ; ingredients: cherries, sugar, flour, cinnamon, pastry for a double-crust 9-inch pie ; preparation:Mix ingredients for filling. Place in pastry-lined pie pan. Put top crust on. Cut vent slits in top crust, and flute edges. Brush with milk and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 425f for 25 minutes, reduce heat to 350f and bake for 25-30 minutes more. Add the cherries and toss to coat. This coats them more even than doing it in a bowl and the filling is firmer. ; name: ms winnie s chocolate pie ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, milk, water, butter, vanilla extract, cocoa, salt, eggs, pie shells ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients well. Add 3 egg yolks and 1 egg white to dry mixture, reserving the other 2 egg whites for the meringue. Add butter and mix well. Slowly stir in milk and water. Over medium heat, cook this mixture until thickened, stirring constantly. Once mixture has thickened, add vanilla extract and bring to room temperature. Once mixture has cooled, pour into baked pie shell. In a separate bowl, beat the two egg whites until soft peaks form. Slowly add 6-7 tablespoons of sugar and continue beating until meringue is stiff, not dry. Top pie with meringue and baked at 350 degrees for approximately 10 minutes until meringue is lightly browned. Refrigerate before serving and refrigerate any leftovers. ; name: nana s sugar cream pie ; ingredients: sugar, flour, salt, whipping cream, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, butter, unbaked pie shell ; preparation:Mix sugar, flour and salt together. Add cream, milk and vanilla. Pour mixture into a 9 inch unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle with cinnamon and dot with butter. Bake in 425 f oven for 10 mins. Reduce heat to 350 f and bake for 1 hr 15 mins. ; name: french silk pie ; ingredients: butter, sugar, cocoa, extra-large eggs, salt, graham cracker crust, whipped cream, nuts, chocolate curls ; preparation:

name: peppery brown sugar salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, brown sugar, onion powder, lemon pepper seasoning, cracked black pepper, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Pat the salmon fillets dry. Brush with melted butter. Combine the seasonings in a small bowl and mix. Sprinkle the seasonings over the salmon and press down gently. On a lightly greased baking sheet, bake for 20-25 minutes. I typically line the baking sheet with foil for easy cleanup. ; name: creamy baked salmon ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, cream, dried basil, salt and pepper, salmon fillets ; preparation:Saut onion and garlic in butter on medium high until onions are translucent. Add tomatoes and cook on high for 5 to 10 minutes untill tomatoes start to break a part. Add cream and simmer on medium low for 5 minutes. Stir basil, salt and pepper in to cream sauce. In an oiled baking dish, pour cream sauce over salmon. Cover and bake for 12 minutes at 350f. Serve over pasta, rice or steamed veggies. ; name: brown sugar grilled salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, lemon pepper, salt, garlic powder, soy sauce, brown sugar, water, vegetable oil ; preparation:Sprinkle fillets with salt, lemon pepper and garlic powder to taste. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, water and oil. Marinate fish in soy mixture for 2 hours or more. Remove from marinade. Grill for 7 minutes per side. ; name: asian style salmon or tofu ; ingredients: bok choy, red bell pepper, salmon fillets, pepper, scallions, low sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, gingerroot ; preparation:Heat oven to 400. Tear off four 15-inch squares of parchment paper. Arrange them evenly on baking sheets. Divide the bok choy and bell pepper evenly on the squares. Place the salmon on top of the vegetables and sprinkle with pepper. Top each square with scallions. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and ginger. Spoon the mixture over the salmon or tofu. Top with another 4 squares of parchment paper and fold the edges over several times to seal. Bake for 15 minutes. When done baking, slit the parchment paper to open and serve, being cautious of the hot steam. For vegetarian use only the tofu. ; name: salt roasted salmon ; ingredients: olive oil, salmon fillets, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, lemon ; preparation:Heat the oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 t oil in a ovenproof skillet until it just shimmers. Add the salmon skin side down and cook until the skin begins to crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Mound the salt around and over each piece, trying to get it to really make a cohesive crust on each one. Roast in oven for 5 minutes per inch of thickness. Remove the salmon from the oven and let sit for 2 minutes in the crust. Carefully brush away the salt. Transfer to a clean work surface and finish removing salt with a pastry brush. Season with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, and serve with a little lemon. The salmon will seem a little dry but will not be overcooked. This really brings out the flavor of the salmon. ; name: salmon with lemon capers and rosemary ; ingredients: salmon fillets, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, fresh rosemary leaf, lemon slices, lemon juice, marsala wine, capers, aluminum foil ; preparation:Brush top and bottom of salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and rosemary. Place each piece of seasoned salmon on a piece of foil large enough to fold over and seal. Top the each piece of salmon with 2 lemon slices, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of wine, and 1 teaspoon of capers. Wrap up salmon tightly in the foil packets. Place a grill pan over medium-high heat or preheat a gas or charcoal grill. Place the foil packets on the hot grill and cook for 10 minutes for a 1-inch thick piece of salmon. Serve in the foil packets. ; name: salmon with sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, yellow onion, gingerroot, pineapple juice, olive oil, salt, salmon fillets, fresh ground black pepper, slivered almonds, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine sweet potatoes, onion, ginger, juice, oil and salt. Place in a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish, sprayed with cooking spray. Bake, covered, for 40 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with salmon. Grind on pepper. Return to oven uncovered and bake 10 to 12 minutes, until fish is done to your liking. Garnish with almonds and parsley. ; name: salmon braised in coconut milk ; ingredients: unsweetened coconut milk, orange juice, orange zest, thai fish sauce, asian chili sauce, garlic clove, fresh ginger, of fresh mint, fresh cilantro stems, salmon fillets ; preparation:

name: homemade maple syrup old fashioned ; ingredients: white sugar, brown sugar, water, butter flavoring, burnt sugar flavoring, maple flavoring ; preparation:Place all but maple flavoring in a medium saucepan, start to cook over medium heat but, turn temperature down just when it reaches a boil. Simmer just 10 minutes and remove from heat. Cool slightly and add maple flavoring. Once cool enough, place in an old syrup bottle, mrs. Butterworths size works really well. ; name: old fashioned butterscotch sauce ; ingredients: light brown sugar, light corn syrup, butter, evaporated milk, baking soda, vanilla ; preparation:In a medium saucepan combine sugar, syrup, and butter. Cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until sugar has dissolved and mixture comes to a full rolling boil. Allow to boil, without stirring, for exactly 1 minute. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. In another bowl or large measuring cup, combine evaporated milk, baking soda, and vanilla. Stir into the slightly cooled sauce. Pour into jars, cover, and refrigerate. Place jar in a pan of warm water to reheat. ; name: caramel rum sauce ; ingredients: brown sugar, cornstarch, half-and-half, water, light corn syrup, butter, rum, vanilla ; preparation:Combine sugar and cornstarch in a heavy saucepan. Stir in cream, water and corn syrup. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in butter, vanilla and rum. Let mixture stand at room temperature until cooled. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 months. ; name: homemade caramel frosting ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, milk, powdered sugar ; preparation:Melt butter in a pan. Add brown sugar and boil for two minutes, stirring constantly. Add milk and stir until mixture boils, remove and cool. Pour into mixing bowl and add powdered sugar a little bit at a time. Beat well after each addition of powdered sugar. ; name: raspberry cream dressing ; ingredients: frozen raspberries, olive oil, whipping cream, sherry wine vinegar, salt ; preparation:Place raspberries in a blender and process until smooth. Pour through a strainer into a bowl and press the mixture with the back of a spoon against the sides of the strainer to squeeze out liquid. Discard seeds. Combine the raspberry puree, olive oil, & remaining ingredients, whisking until smooth. Chill. ; name: non alcoholic hard sauce ; ingredients: powdered sugar, butter, salt, vanilla extract, heavy cream ; preparation:Sift powdered sugar and set aside. Beat butter until soft. Gradually beat in the sugar until well blended. Beat in salt and vanilla. Beat in heavy cream. When sauce is very smooth chill thoroughly. Serve. ; name: chocolate syrup sauce ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa powder, butter, salt, real vanilla, evaporated milk, half-and-half, cream ; preparation:Mix the cocoa powder, pinch of salt, and the sugar together evenly. Stir in the condensed milk. Put in a pan or double boiler along with the butter, and turn on the heat to medium. Bring to boil for a minute or so. Be sure to stir constantly, or else it will get scorched on the bottom. Turn off the heat and let it cool. As the syrup is cooling down, stir in the teaspoon of real vanilla. Great on ice cream, but this stuff is delicious enough to eat straight. ; name: maple caramel sauce for ice cream served at 2013 obama inaugural ; ingredients: butter, light brown sugar, salt, maple syrup ; preparation:

name: hearty breakfast casserole ; ingredients: bacon, biscuits, eggs, cheese, sour cream, salt, pepper, green onion ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Quarter biscuits, and place at bottom of pan. Layer with cooked bacon and shredded cheese. In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, sour cream, salt, and pepper and pour over cheese and biscuits. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool 5-10 minutes before serving. Garnish with onions, if desired. ; name: farmer s breakfast casserole ; ingredients: frozen hash brown potatoes, monterey jack cheese, cooked ham, green onion, eggs, evaporated milk, pepper, salt ; preparation:Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. ; name: country club eggs a great make ahead breakfast casserole ; ingredients: pork sausage, eggs, white bread, salt, dry mustard, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown sausage in skillet, stirring until browned and crumbled. Then drain. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 casserole dish. Regfrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for 45 minutes or until center tests done. ; name: savory egg casserole ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, butter, cream, prepared mustard, salt, pepper, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle cheese in 9x9 inch square baking dish. Dot with butter. Mix cream, mustard, salt, and pepper, and pour half of the mixture over the cheese. Pour eggs on top. Pour remaining cream mixture over the eggs. Bake 25 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: spinach and cheese casserole ; ingredients: frozen spinach, onion, garlic cloves, butter, eggs, cottage cheese, flour, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour. ; name: make ahead breakfast ; ingredients: sausage, bread, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, salt, mustard ; preparation:Brown sausage in skillet and drain well. Grease 13 x 9 inch casserole dish. Line dish with bread, then top with cheese and sausage. In bowl, combine eggs, milk, and seasonings. Beat well and pour into casserole. Refrigerate overnight. In the morning, bake casserole at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. ; name: granny s hamburger casserole ; ingredients: lean ground beef, vidalia onions, red potatoes, cheddar cheese, condensed cream of mushroom soup, water, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a dutch oven, brown hamburger meat. Drain off fat. In the dutch oven, top meat with all of the sliced onions, then the potatoes. Salt the potatoes. Top with shredded cheese. Combine soup and soup can of water in a bowl and blend with spoon until smooth. Spread soup mixture over the cheese. Bake covered at 350 for about an hour. ; name: breakfast casserole by loretta ; ingredients: bread, cheese, cooked sausage, eggs, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: jalapeno corn casserole ; ingredients: cream cheese, butter, frozen corn, milk, all-purpose flour, jalapeno pepper ; preparation:Using electric mixer, mix cream cheese and butter very well. Gradually mix in milk. Mix in flour and jalapenos. Stir in corn. Pour into a 9x9 greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes, or until bubbling and golden brown on top. ; name: bbq jalapeno poppers ; ingredients: jalapenos, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, green onion, bacon, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 275f. Cut jalapenos in half lengthwise and scrape out seeds. In a bowl, combine cheeses and onion and mix well. Stuff each hollowed jalapeno half with cheese mixture. Wrap bacon slices around each half, cover as much of the surface as possible. Brush bacon surface with bbq sauce. Secure with toothpicks and pop into oven for 1 hr. ; name: jalapeno cheese soup ; ingredients: chicken broth, celery, yellow onions, garlic salt, white pepper, velveeta cheese, jalapeno pepper, sour cream, flour tortilla ; preparation:Cut the velveeta cheese into cubes. In a large saucepan, place the chicken broth, diced celery, diced onions, garlic salt and white pepper. Cook over high heat for 10 minutes, or until the mixture reduces and thickens slightly. In a blender or food processor, place the broth and the cubed velveeta cheese. Puree them together until the mixture is smooth. Return the pureed mixture to the saucepan and simmer it for 5 minutes. Add the diced jalapeno peppers and mix thoroughly. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and a warm flour tortillas. ; name: jalapeno pepper mac n cheese ; ingredients: salt and pepper, cavatappi pasta, extra virgin olive oil, jalapenos, serrano chilies, garlic cloves, whole milk, cream cheese, dried onion flakes, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Bring a large pot of water to a boil, salt it, add the pasta and cook until al dente. Drain and return to the pot. In a skillet, heat a drizzle of evoo over medium heat. Add the jalapenos, serranos and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add to the pasta. Preheat the broiler. In a saucepan, combine the milk, cream cheese and onion over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, until smooth, 5 minutes. Stir into the pasta. Stir in the jack cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the pasta to a baking dish and broil until browned, about 3 minutes. ; name: jalapeno corn grits ; ingredients: butter, jalapeno, fresh corn kernels, onion, grits, water, fresh thyme, kosher salt, cracked black pepper ; preparation:Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the jalapeno, corn and onion. Saute until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the grits. Add the water gradually, stirring constantly. Cook over medium heat until the grits have absorbed all the water, stirring constantly. Stir in the thyme and season with salt and pepper. ; name: grilled pepper jack jalapeno burgers ; ingredients: ground chuck, jalapeno peppers, garlic cloves, onion, monterey jack pepper cheese, hamburger buns ; preparation:Prepare grill for cooking on high heat. Mix jalapeno pepper, garlic, onion and ground beef in bowl. Separate beef mixture into about 7 equal bundles. Place a thick slice of pepper jack cheese into center of each beef bundle. Form bundles into patties. Brush grill grate with oil. Grill hamburger patties 5 minutes per side, or until desired doneness. Remove burgers from grill. Top with more pepper jack cheese. Let rest on serving plate for 5 minutes. Serve on toasted buns with condiments of your choice. ; name: crispy jalapeno popper dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, green chilies, jalapeno peppers, mexican blend cheese, mozzarella cheese, panko breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees and spray an oven safe serving dish with non-stick cooking spray. Using an electric mixer, blend the cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in green chilies, jalapeno peppers, and mexican and mozzarella cheeses. Spoon this mixture into the prepared baking dish. Mix together the panko and parmesan cheese and sprinkle it over the cream cheese mixture. Spray the panko and parmesan with a quick spray of non-stick cooking spray. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the mixture is hot and the topping is lightly browned. ; name: bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers ; ingredients: jalapenos, cream cheese, bacon, toothpick ; preparation:

name: pat s buttermilk pancakes ; ingredients: eggs, buttermilk, salt, sugar, flour, baking soda, baking powder, vegetable oil ; preparation:Beat eggs. Add milk, salt, and sugar. Beat thoroughly. Add enough flour to make a batter consistency. Do not beat well. Hot cake batter should be slightly lumpy. Add baking soda and baking powder. Stir in oil. ; name: rich pancakes and waffles ; ingredients: eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, salt, butter, vanilla, nutmeg ; preparation:Seperate eggs and beat whites till fluffy but not dry, set aside. Mix all dry ingredients together, set aside. Beat yolks and milk. Slowly add dry ingredients beat till smooth. Mix in melted butter. Do not overbeat. Fold in egg whites. Cook over medium heat till golden. ; name: best ever buttermilk pancakes ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, buttermilk, egg, oil ; preparation:Using a food processor, mix together all dry ingredients and pulse 4-5 times to blend. Add remaining ingredients and process until smooth. About 10 seconds. Do not overprocess. Pour onto a hot slightly greased griddle and cook until bubbles appear on the top side. Flip over and brown. ; name: breakfast eggcake ; ingredients: egg, milk, pancake mix, butter, bacon bits, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Stir ingredients together gently. Add more milk as necessary to make batter the consistency of buttermilk. Melt butter in omelette pan or small skillet over medium high heat. Pour batter into skillet and cook until edges appear dry. Flip eggcake over and cook until set, about another minute. Slide onto serving plate and serve with maple syrup or your favorite pancake topping. ; name: gluten free dairy free egg free pancakes ; ingredients: tapioca flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, cooking oil, baking powder, water, brown sugar, rice flour ; preparation:Mix all dry ingredients first. Add oil and water, mix well. Use ladle to measure desired mixture into desired non-stick skillet. Cook as desired, flip and cook opposite side. Remove from heat. Use cooking spray to grease skillet with before cooking pancakes, or use 1 teaspoon butter to grease skillet, if desired for added flavor. ; name: sweet corn pancakes ; ingredients: eggs, half-and-half, sour cream, flour, baking soda, baking powder, corn, vegetable oil ; preparation:Beat the egg whites until they hold soft peaks when the beaters are lifted up. In another bowl, combine the egg yolks, half-and-half, and sour cream. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the egg yolk mixture. Add the beaten egg whites, using a gentle stirring motion to combine them with the yolk mixture. Add the corn and stir gently. Pour a small amount of oil into a non-stick pan and heat it over medium heat. Drop batter, about 1 tablespoon at a time, into the pan for each pancake and cook until golden brown on each side. Serve with butter if desired. ; name: the best no kidding buttermilk pancakes ; ingredients: eggs, buttermilk, baking soda, baking powder, salt, flour, sugar, unsalted butter ; preparation:Beat the yolks until pale and smooth. Beat in the buttermilk and then the baking soda and mix well. Sift in the dry ingredients mixing as you add. Make sure the batter is smooth. Add in the melted butter and mix well. Beat the egg whites in another bowl until stiff. Fold into the batter until no bits of white are visible. Let batter stand about 20 minutes before making pancakes. Make sure your griddle is really hot. Ladle batter onto griddle. Turn when bubbles form across the cakes and allow to lightly brown on the second side. Serve with warm maple syrup and sweet butter. ; name: pancakes milk free ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, egg, orange juice, water, vegetable oil, vegetable oil cooking spray ; preparation:

name: mushroom and wine steak sauce ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, onion, garlic, condensed beef broth, tomato paste, ground pepper, cornstarch, water, dry red wine ; preparation:Melt butter in a saucepan. Add mushrooms, onion and garlic. Saute until golden, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth, tomato paste and black pepper. Bring to the boiling point. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Blend cornstarch with water. Mix some of the hot mushroom sauce into cornstarch mixture and return to saucepan. Cook and stir until clear and thickened. Stir in wine and cook until hot. Serve over steak, hamburgers or other meat. ; name: all day mushrooms ; ingredients: button mushrooms, butter, burgundy wine, worcestershire sauce, garlic, dried dill, pepper, chicken bouillon cubes, beef bouillon cubes ; preparation:Wet a paper towel and wipe any dirt from the mushrooms. Place the mushrooms in a large stockpot. Add the remaining ingredients to the pot. The liquid will not cover the mushrooms at first. Cook, covered, over very low heat for 4 hours. Stir occasionally so that all of the mushrooms are completely coated with the cooking liquid. Remove the cover and cook for an additional 4 hours. The mushrooms will shrimk by half and become saturated with cooking liquid. Remove with a slotted spoon and serve in a bowl. ; name: little grilled mushroom bites ; ingredients: mushrooms, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt & fresh black pepper, garlic cloves, fresh herbs, fresh breadcrumb, cheese, sherry wine ; preparation:Prepare a medium-hot fire in the grill with a vegetable grill in place. Remove stems from mushrooms and hollow out the caps. Brush both sides of mushroom caps with olive and sprinkle inside of caps with salt and pepper. Grill mushrooms, hollow side down, until partially cooked and set aside. Combine reserved mushroom stems and trimmings with remaining olive oil and garlic and toss to coat well. Grill, tossing frequently, until lightly cooked. Finely chop the mushroom pieces and garlic, either by hand or with a food processor. Combine in medium-sized bowl with the breadcrumbs, cheese, sherry and herbs. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stuff into the mushroom caps, mounding up the filling and pressing with your fingers to pack tightly. Grill stuffed mushrooms, stuffing side up, until the mushrooms are completely cooked and the cheese is melted. Serve hot or warm. ; name: sage mushrooms ; ingredients: butter, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic cloves, red wine, salt, black pepper, fresh sage ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Cook the onion, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add the mushrooms and garlic. Cook for about 12 minutes or until no liquid remains. Add the wine, salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes or until the wine has almost evaporated. Stir in the sage. ; name: roasted mushroom medley ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, olive oil, salt & pepper, fresh rosemary, fresh sage, fresh parsley, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Remove the stems from the caps, chop off the ends, and cut into large pieces. Cut the mushrooms into pieces no larger than 2 inches in size. Mix the olive oil with the garlic, herbs and seasonings in an ovenproof casserole dish large enough to fit all of the mushrooms. Add the mushrooms, and mix well, coating the mushrooms with the flavored oil. Bake for about 30 to 40 minutes, or until cooked through. Remove from the heat, and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar. ; name: mushrooms and alioli tapas ; ingredients: mushrooms, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, sherry wine, mayonnaise, french bread ; preparation:Heat olive oil in pan. When the oil is hot, add the mushrooms, salt and sharry. Cover, and lower heat. Cook until liquid is released from mushrooms, about 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. Toast bread slightly, just to dry it out a bit. Spread toast with alioli and top with mushrooms. Broil for about 30 seconds or until alioli starts to bubble. Serve warm. ; name: italian mushrooms in vinegar funghi al salamoia ; ingredients: button mushroom, spices, garlic clove, wine vinegar, salt ; preparation:Wipe mushrooms well with damp cloth. Heat vinegar until lukewarm. Put mushrooms in a sterilized glass jar. Add spices, garlic, warm vinegar, & salt & stir thoroughly. Cover jar tightly. Set aside in dry place for 2 days. ; name: red wine mushrooms the easy way ; ingredients: small mushroom, olive oil, butter, garlic granules, red wine ; preparation:

name: scrambled eggs in a bowl ; ingredients: eggs, nonstick cooking spray, salt and pepper, butter ; preparation:Spray a serving bowl with cooking spray. Crack the eggs into the bowl, and stir up with a fork, making sure the yolks are broken. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover the bowl with a paper towel and microwave for 1 minute. Remove from the microwave and cut the cooked parts of the eggs with a knife and fork. Return to the microwave, cover, and cook for 1 more minute. Remove from the microwave, cut the eggs up and top with a pat of butter if you wish. As an option, put chunked ham or bacon in the eggs while cooking. Great as well with a small spoon of cheez whiz mixed in after it is done cooking. ; name: creamy scrambled eggs with fines herbes ; ingredients: eggs, mixed herbs, kosher salt, butter, baguette, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, herbs, and salt. Stir in 1 tablespoon of the butter. Heat a small skillet over medium low heat. Add egg mixture and cook, while stirring, so that the eggs do not set too fast. The eggs will begin to set and form a creamy sauce. Add in the remaining butter, one piece at a time, continuing to stir. Arrange the toasts on serving plates.
