After draining, place the tortellini on low heat. Add in pasta and alfredo sauce, mix well until the sauce looks pink. Cover and let stand on low heat for 5 minutes. Add parmesan cheese, mix well, and serve. ; name: westphalian tortellini ; ingredients: tortellini, sweet butter, westphalian ham, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, fresh chives, frozen peas, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: apple pecan tart ; ingredients: unbaked pie shell, sugar, corn syrup, eggs, butter, pecans, vanilla, apples, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pie crust in a 9-inch tart pan and leave the sides long and free-form. Combine sugar and corn syrup. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add pecans and vanilla, and teaspoon of melted butter and mix well. Set aside. Toss apples with lemon juice. Spread apples on bottom of pie crust and pour pecan mixture over apples. Fold edges of pie crust over filling. Bake pie until set, about 45 to 50 minutes. ; name: fruit crisp ; ingredients: apples, granulated sugar, rolled oats, brown sugar, all-purpose flour, ground nutmeg, butter, coconut, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. If fruit is frozen, thaw but do not drain. Place fruit in a 2-quart square baking dish. Stir in the granulated sugar. For topping, in a medium bowl combine the oats, brown sugar, flour, and nutmeg. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the nuts. Sprinkle topping over filling. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until fruit is tender and topping is golden. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream if desired. ; name: toffee dip with apples ; ingredients: brown sugar, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, reduced-fat cream cheese, toffee pieces, pineapple juice, red delicious apples, granny smith apples ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl. Beat at medium speed of a mixer until smooth. Add toffee bits and mix well. Cover and chill. Combine juice and apples in a bowl. Toss well. Drain apples. Serve with dip. ; name: baked apple slices ; ingredients: baking apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ground ginger, apple cider, butter, raisins, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Place apples in greased 1 quart baking dish. Combine sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and apple cider. Pour over apples. Dot with butter. Sprinkle with raisins. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45-60 minutes or until apples are tender. Serve warm over ice cream if desired. ; name: apple butterscotch macadamia pie ; ingredients: eggs, light corn syrup, tart apples, butter, vanilla extract, salt, ground cinnamon, macadamia nuts, nestl toll house butterscotch flavored morsels, unbaked 9-inch pie shell ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Combine eggs, corn syrup, apple, butter, vanilla extract, salt and cinnamon in large bowl. Mix well. Stir in nuts and morsels. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until edge is set but center still moves slightly. Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate. ; name: crustless milk tart ; ingredients: milk, butter, flour, salt, baking powder, eggs, sugar, vanilla essence ; preparation:Melt the butter, add the egg yolks and sugar. Beat with a fork. Add the dry ingredients and milk to the egg mixture. Stifly beat the egg whites, fold into the mix and blend well. Pour into an oven dish about 35x20cm- the mixture should be about 3cm deep. Bake at 160c for 45-60mins. It is lovely with cinnamon sprinkled on top before cooking. ; name: apple dumpling bake ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, granny smith apples, sugar, butter, mountain dew soda, ground cinnamon, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Seperate crescent rolls into 16 triangles. Cut each apple into eight wedges. Wrap a triangle around each apple wedge. Place in a greased 13-in. X 9-in. X 2-in. Baking dish. In a bowl, combine sugar and butter and sprinkle over rolls. Slowly pour the soda around the rolls. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream. ; name: quick easy and yummy apple tart ; ingredients: puff pastry, apples, brown sugar, salt, caramel topping, whipped cream, powdered sugar, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:

name: pampered chef chicken salad tea sandwiches ; ingredients: white chicken meat, mayonnaise, apricot jam, raisins, onion, white bread ; preparation:Combine chicken, mayo, jam, raisins and onion in small bowl. Place 1 scoop chicken mixture in center of 8 slices of bread, spreading slightly. Top with remaining bread slices. Center cut-n-seal over bread. Cut and seal. ; name: meatloaf sandwich ; ingredients: whole wheat bread, meatloaf, barbecue sauce, cheese ; preparation:Lightly toast the bread. Remove from toaster, and cover each slice with bbq sauce or ketchup. Microwave leftover meatloaf, with cheese on top to melt. Place meatloaf on top of 1 slice of toast, then cover with other one. Press down and cut the sandwich diagonally. ; name: salad sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, russian salad dressing, tomatoes, lettuce, watercress ; preparation:Spread the dressing on one slice of bread. Place a lettuce leaf on the bread. Top with two slices of tomato. Top with the watercress. Add the remaining tomato and the other slice of bread. ; name: grilled chicken and cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: cooked chicken, raisins, almonds, celery, mayonnaise, monterey jack cheese, whole wheat bread, butter ; preparation:For the chicken mixture, stir the first five ingredients together. Using half the bread place 1 slice of cheese on each slice of bread. Spread the chicken mixture on evenly and top with cheese. Spread butter on one side of each of the sandwiches, cook with butter side down on medium heat for about three minutes or until light and brown. Spread the other side with remaining butter and cook for three minutes. ; name: caribbean style chicken sandwich ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, jerk rub, garlic cloves, mayonnaise, cayenne pepper, roasted red peppers, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, whole wheat hamburger buns, swiss cheese ; preparation:Apply the jerk rub to the chicken, leaving enough time to marinate as stated by the recipe or bottle you are using. When ready to prepare dish, combine the garlic, mayonnaise, and cayenne pepper, and mix well. Add the diced roasted red pepper and pulse through a blender or food processor. Prepare a pan with nonstick cook spray and cook the chicken over medium heat, flipping it occasionally until it is cooked through. Split and toast the wheat buns. Spread red pepper mixture over one half and place the cheese slice on the other. Top the cheese with the hot chicken, add the roasted peppers, placing a mixture of both kinds on each sandwich, and top with the remaining bun half. Enjoy as is, or you can give it a quick 20-30 seconds in the microwave to heat up the roasted peppers, as well. ; name: white sandwich bread ; ingredients: water, milk, butter, flour, sugar, salt, yeast ; preparation:Heat first three ingredients to 120f-130f. Using only 2 cups of the flour, gradually add the rest of the ingredients. Beat two minutes with an electric mixer. Add 1 cup of flour or enough to make a thick batter. Beat another 2 minutes. Add more flour to make a soft dough. Knead 8-10 minutes. Form into loaves and place in greased loaf pans. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 400f for 30 minutes. ; name: baked cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, butter, mustard, velveeta cheese, eggs, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:Butter both sides of bread. Lay 8 slices in a 9x13 inch pan. Spread mustard on top. Cover each slice with velveeta cheese. Cover with remaining bread slices. In seperate bowl mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour over bread and place in refrigerator overnight, or for at least 6 hours. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Cut into serving size pieces and serve hot. ; name: classic club sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, mayonnaise, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, cooked bacon, cooked chicken breasts, sticks ; preparation:

name: eggnog coffee cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, eggnog, vanilla extract, flour, baking powder, salt, pecans, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Butter 9 inch fluted or plain tube pan. In large bowl of electric mixer, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, eggnog, and vanilla. Stir together flour, bakng powder, and salt. Gradually beat into butter mixture. Prepare topping by combining nuts, sugar and cinnamon. Scatter half the topping evenly over bottom of pan. Spoon in half batter. Add remaining topping and spoon on remaining batter. Bake 50 to 60 minute, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes before removing from pan. ; name: eggnog caramels ; ingredients: sugar, brown sugar, butter flavor shortening, light corn syrup, eggnog, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with a double-thickness of foil. Coat well with cooking spray. Place all ingredients in a heavy, deep-sided saucepan. Attach a candy thermometer to the side of the saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Lower heat to medium and continue cooking, stirring constantly, until mixture reaches 245 degrees f. Immediately pour caramel mixture into prepared pan. Cool and refrigerate for 3 hours or more, until completely firm. Using foil, lift caramel slab from prepared pan. Pull the foil down from the sides of the caramel. Using a long knife, trim the edges off the caramel slab, and then cut the block of caramel into 8 rows. Cut each row into 8 squares. ; name: old fashioned homemade eggnog ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, bourbon, brandy, heavy cream, nutmeg ; preparation:Beat the egg yolks with the sugar until pale yellow. Add the bourbon and the brandy and blend well. Chill in the fridge for several hours. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form and set aside. In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until slightly thickened. Fold the cream into the chilled yolk mixture. Fold in the egg whites and chill again. Serve with a sprinkling of grated nutmeg. Makes 20 servings. ; name: egg free french toast ; ingredients: whole grain bread, milk, cornstarch, sugar, vanilla extract, butter, salt ; preparation:Preheat griddle to just above medium heat. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread and butter. Mix until the cornstach is disolved. Transfer mixture to a shallow bowl or pan. Dip both sides of each bread slice into the mixture. Melt butter on the griddle or skillet. Place bread on heated surface and cook each side to a light golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: eggnog muffins 1982 ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, eggnog, dark rum, butter, egg, nutmeg ; preparation:Preheat oven 400f. Grease muffin tin. Sift dry ingredients into a large bowl. Stir in the eggnog, rum, butter, egg, and nutmeg. Spoon into 12 greased muffin cups. Bake 18- 20 minutes or until tester comes away clean. Cool completely, on a wire rack-- serve--room temperature. ; name: homemade eggnog ; ingredients: evaporated milk, water, powdered milk, sugar, egg yolks, egg whites, whiskey ; preparation:In large pot, heat up all ingredients except whiskey and eggs. Separate eggs. Return yellows to milk mixture. Beat egg whites with a little sugar to form peak. Return to milk mixture. Add whiskey to taste. ; name: down east corn bread ; ingredients: cornmeal, sugar, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f grease a 9x9 inche metal baking pan. In large bowl, combine first 6 ingredients. In medium bowl, whisk buttermilk, oil, and egg until blended. Stir into cornmeal mixture just until moistened. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until golden and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cut cornbread into 9 squares. ; name: eggnog quick bread ; ingredients: eggs, white sugar, butter, eggnog, rum extract, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, ground nutmeg ; preparation:

name: thai green curry shrimp soup ; ingredients: large shrimp, green curry paste, straw mushrooms, carrot, green beans, chinese cabbage, tamarind paste, brown sugar, fish sauce ; preparation:In a large saucepan, simmer shrimp in enough water to cover, until cooked or orange-pink in color, about 1-2 minutes. Cool shrimp in the stock and then peel. Reserve 4 cups of the stock. Set aside. Heat the reserved 4 cups of stock in a saucepan over high heat. Stir in the green curry paste. Add the mushrooms, carrot, green beans, and cabbage. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are just tender. Stir in tamarind paste, sugar, and fish sauce. Place some shrimp in a bowl and ladle in the soup. ; name: salmon rice bake ; ingredients: water, carrots, onion, chicken bouillon powder, broccoli floret, instant rice, condensed cream of mushroom soup, canned pink salmon, paprika ; preparation:Combine water, carrot, onion and bouillon powder in a large saucepan. Cover and cook until onion is almost tender. Add broccoli. Cook for 4 minutes. Do not drain. Stir in rice. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Add soup and salmon. Stir to mix well. Turn into greased 2 qt casserole dish. Sprinkle with paprika if desired. Cover and bake at 350f for 30 minutes. ; name: red curry with vegetables ; ingredients: coconut milk, red curry paste, chicken stock, fish sauce, brown sugar, zucchini, sugar snap peas, mushroom, bamboo shoot ; preparation:Combine 4 ounces coconut milk, curry paste, stock, fish sauce, and sugar and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add vegetables and remaining coconut milk and simmer an additional 15 minutes. If using snow peas, add just before serving. Serve with rice. ; name: thai red pork curry with corn and peas ; ingredients: peanut oil, red curry paste, lean pork, coconut milk, corn kernel, fresh peas, fish sauce, brown sugar, lime rind, thai basil ; preparation:Heat oil in wok, add curry paste and stir fry for one minute. Add pork, stir fry until lightly browned. Add coconut milk and one cup water, bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add corn and peas to wok, cook for 5 minutes. Add fish sauce, brown sugar, lime rind and basil leaves, toss well. Serve with steamed rice. ; name: citrus balsamic glazed salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, salt and pepper, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, cornstarch, orange juice, brown sugar, chicken broth ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Rub salmon with salt and pepper. Place salmon in 2-quart shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Whisk balsamic vinegar, cornstarch, orange juice and brown sugar in medium saucepan. Add chicken broth and heat to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, stirring until the mixture thickens. Arrange salmon on serving platter and serve with sauce. Serve over hot white rice, if desired. ; name: sweet orange salmon ; ingredients: brown sugar, chili powder, orange rind, ground cumin, paprika, salt, ground coriander, black pepper, salmon fillets ; preparation:Preheat broiler. Combine brown sugar, chili powder, orange zest, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, and coriander in a small bowl. Rub spice mixture over both sides of salmon fillets. Place salmon on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil for 8 minute or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. ; name: cabbage curry ; ingredients: cabbage, green chilies, onion, garlic cloves, canola oil, salt, chili powder, turmeric, canned tuna ; preparation:In a medium sized pan, pour the oil and heat under high heat. After 1 minute, add the onions, garlic, and salt. Fry until onion and garlic are slightly turning gold. Add the chillies and continue frying. Keep stirring the whole time to avoid burning on the bottom of pan. When the onions and garlic look golden, but not browned, add chilli powder, turmeric and tuna. Stir the ingredients well for about 1 minute or so. Lower the heat to the lowest it can go. Now add the cabbage to the rest of the ingredients in the pot and gently stir around until the cabbage is fully coated with the rest of the ingredients. Place a lid on the pot and let it cook for about 30 minutes taste and see if the cabbage is cooked after 30 minutes. If not, leave it for another 5 min or so until you think its cooked. Goes well with rice or naan, or just as a side dish. ; name: thai green curry salmon ; ingredients: skinless salmon fillet, unsweetened coconut milk, green curry paste, brown sugar, fish sauce, fresh lime juice, red bell pepper, mushroom, fresh basil, jasmine rice ; preparation:

name: scrambled eggs with herbs and smoked salmon ; ingredients: eggs, cream, salt, cracked black pepper, butter, herbs, bagels, smoked salmon ; preparation:Whisk eggs, cream and salt and pepper in a bowl. Melt butter in a non-stick frying pan over medium high heat until foaming. Add egg mixture, sprinkle with herbs and cook for 3 minutes. Gently draw in edges with a fork to allow uncooked egg to run underneath and cook until eggs are just set. Remove from pan and keep warm. Meanwhile, place bagels in a toaster or oven grill and toast until golden brown. Spoon eggs onto bagels and top with flaked salmon. ; name: creamed salmon on toast ; ingredients: flour, margarine, milk, salmon, frozen peas, salt and pepper, bread ; preparation:1 thaw frozen peas in a collendar. 2 melt the margarine in a saucepan. 3 add the flour and blend. 4 add the milk, stirring constantly to prevent clumping and stir until creamy. 5 add the salmon, peas, salt and pepper and warm through. 6 as the salmon is warming, toast the bread. 7 after toasted, spoon salmon mixture over the toast. ; name: creamy baked salmon ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, cream, dried basil, salt and pepper, salmon fillets ; preparation:Saut onion and garlic in butter on medium high until onions are translucent. Add tomatoes and cook on high for 5 to 10 minutes untill tomatoes start to break a part. Add cream and simmer on medium low for 5 minutes. Stir basil, salt and pepper in to cream sauce. In an oiled baking dish, pour cream sauce over salmon. Cover and bake for 12 minutes at 350f. Serve over pasta, rice or steamed veggies. ; name: smoked salmon frittata ; ingredients: eggs, milk, chives, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, red onion, cream cheese, smoked salmon, fresh tomatoes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs until well beaten and slightly frothy. Whisk in milk, chives and black pepper. Set aside. In a large ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil or butter over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add egg mixture to skillet and then quickly arrange remaining ingredients on top of eggs. Cook for 3 minutes on the stovetop without stirring. Transfer to oven. Bake until the top is golden brown and the frittata is set, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving. ; name: salt roasted salmon ; ingredients: olive oil, salmon fillets, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, lemon ; preparation:Heat the oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 t oil in a ovenproof skillet until it just shimmers. Add the salmon skin side down and cook until the skin begins to crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Mound the salt around and over each piece, trying to get it to really make a cohesive crust on each one. Roast in oven for 5 minutes per inch of thickness. Remove the salmon from the oven and let sit for 2 minutes in the crust. Carefully brush away the salt. Transfer to a clean work surface and finish removing salt with a pastry brush. Season with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, and serve with a little lemon. The salmon will seem a little dry but will not be overcooked. This really brings out the flavor of the salmon. ; name: broiled salmon with bacon ; ingredients: salmon fillet, salt, fresh ground pepper, bacon, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Heat broiler. Season salmon with salt and pepper. Place skin side down in a broiler pan or cookie sheet. Cover with bacon strips. Brush salmon and bacon with 1 t. Of the balsamic vinegar. Broil until cooked through and bacon is crisp, about 8 minutes, basting with remaining 1 t. Vinegar halfway through cooking. ; name: open face tuna melt sandwich ; ingredients: bread, tuna in water, mayonnaise, onion, lemon juice, old bay seasoning, salt and pepper, tomatoes, provolone cheese ; preparation:Mix the tuna, mayo, onion, lemon juice, old bay seasoning, salt and pepper. Mix well. Place enough tuna on a toasted slice of bread and spread to cover slice. Top with slice of tomato and then top with a slice of cheese. Place sandwich slices on a cookie sheet. Placing rack not too close to the broiler, broil sandwiches until the cheese is golden brown. ; name: open face salmon and egg scandinavian sandwich ; ingredients: smoked salmon, eggs, salt, black pepper, fresh dill sprigs, butter, miniature party rye rounds ; preparation:

name: chocolate dream cookies ; ingredients: unsalted saltine crackers, unsalted butter, light brown sugar, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Place crackers in a single layer on a cookie sheet that has sides. Melt butter and sugar over medium to medium-high heat. Boil together for 3 minutes. Pour over the crackers to cover. Bake at 400f for 7 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately spread the chocolate chips on the top. Cool, then freeze for 2 hours or until hard. Break into pieces like peanut brittle. Store in a covered container in the refrigerator. ; name: butterscotch cashew bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, sugar, butter, butterscotch chips, sweetened condensed milk, salted cashew halves ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Stir in melted butter. Press mixture firmly into bottom of a 13 x 9 pan. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup morsels with condensed milk. Microwave on high in 30 second intervals, stirring after each, until melted and smooth. Pour mixture over crumbs. Sprinkle remaining morsels and cashews on top. Bake 20 to 22 minutes, til lightly browned. Let them cool completely before cutting into bars. ; name: strawberry no bake cheesecake bars ; ingredients: cinnamon graham cracker crumbs, butter, sugar, powdered sugar, cream cheese, strawberry jam, strawberries, cool whip ; preparation:Mix the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter or margarine and sugar together. Press firmly into a 13x9 inch pan and refridg while making the filling. Beat the cream cheese till smooth. Slowly add the powdered sugar. Add the jam and mix well. Stir in the strawberries and then fold in the cool whip. Spoon over the crust, cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours to set up enough to cut cleanly. ; name: coco nutty tropical treat bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, icing sugar, butter, sweetened condensed milk, crushed pineapple in juice, sweetened flaked coconut, almonds, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375, grease a 9x13 pan. In a medium bowl, mix graham crumbs and icing sugar, stir in butter until evenly blended. Press crumb mixture firmly into bottom of prepared pan. Bake until edges are golden brown about 10-12 minutes. In a large bowl stir condensed milk, pineapple, coconut& almonds. With a rubber spatula dollop pineapple mixture onto crumb crust and spread almost to the edges. Bake until just set, 10-15 minutes. Remove from oven& sprinkle with white chocolate chips, let stand until chocolate softens, 3-4 minutes. Then spread chocolate over surface. Cool completely, cut into bars. ; name: layered coconut bars ; ingredients: margarine, vanilla wafer crumbs, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts, flaked coconut, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Combine butter and crumbs in an 8-inch square baking dish. Press down to form a crust. Sprinkle with chocolate chips, nuts and coconut. Pour milk over all. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes. ; name: chocolate raisin cookie bars ; ingredients: butter, graham crackers, raisins, flaked coconut, nuts, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Melt butter in 13x9-inch baking pan in preheated 350f oven. Remove from oven. Sprinkle graham crumbs in butter. Mix well. Press into bottom of pan. Sprinkle with chocolate-covered raisins, coconut and nuts. Press down firmly. Pour sweetened condensed milk over top. Bake for 25-30 minutes or ntil light golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. ; name: marshmallow fudge ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, fat-free sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, miniature marshmallows, low-fat graham crackers ; preparation:Line an 8-in. Square pan wih foil and coatwith cooking spray. Set aside. In a heavy saucepan over low heat, mel chocolatechips with milk. Stir until smooth. Remove from the hear. Cool for 2 minutes. Stir in vanilla. Fold in the marshmallows and graham crackers. Pour into the prepared pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Lif out pan and remove foil. ; name: omg raspberry dream bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, sugar, butter, sweetened condensed milk, seedless raspberry jam, flaked coconut, cashews, white chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: whole wheat graham cracker cookies ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, butter, honey ; preparation:Mix together flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda. In a seperate bowl combine honey and butter then pour into dry ingredients. Mix well then drop onto a greased baking sheet. Press out the mixture to the corners of the baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Cut them quickly when they come out or use cookie cutter for fun shapes. ; name: goody cookies ; ingredients: graham crackers, butter, brown sugar, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:Line a jelly roll pan with foil. Arrange graham crackers in the pan in a single layer to cover pan. Combine butter and sugar in a heavy medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Boil for 2 minutes until the consistency of carmel. Stir in vanilla and chopped nuts. Drizzle the hot mixture over crackers and spread evenly. Bake 10 minutes at 300. Remove at once from pan to flat surface to cool. When cool, break into smaller pieces. ; name: chocolate raisin cookie bars ; ingredients: butter, graham crackers, raisins, flaked coconut, nuts, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Melt butter in 13x9-inch baking pan in preheated 350f oven. Remove from oven. Sprinkle graham crumbs in butter. Mix well. Press into bottom of pan. Sprinkle with chocolate-covered raisins, coconut and nuts. Press down firmly. Pour sweetened condensed milk over top. Bake for 25-30 minutes or ntil light golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. ; name: soft and yummy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, brown sugar, white sugar, egg, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream margarine. Add gradually and beat in brown sugar and white sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift and stir in flour, salt, baking soda. Add chocolate chips. Bake 10 minutes at 375. ; name: very chewy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: shortening, margarine, brown sugar, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f. First, cream both sugars with the shortening, margarine, eggs, and vanilla. Then, gradually add soda, salt and flour. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake 8-9 minutes. ; name: big and chewy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: light brown sugar, white sugar, margarine, eggs, vanilla, flour, salt, baking soda, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream together sugars and margarine until fluffy with mixer. Blend in eggs, 1 at a time. Blend in vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Add flour, combining with a spoon. Add chocolate chips. Use an ice cream scoop for measurement and place on shiny cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for 18-20 minutes or until golden. ; name: light chocolate chip oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: margarine, dark brown sugar, egg, vanilla, cinnamon, whole wheat flour, baking powder, oats, dark chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine margarine, sugar, egg, vanilla and cinnamon. Stir until creamy and smooth. I microwave the margarine for about 30 seconds to soften. Add flour and baking powder and stir until completely combined. Add oats and then chocolate chips. Spoon onto greased cookie sheets with a soup spoon with about an inch between each cookie. Bake at 350 f for 11 minutes. I used two sheets in the oven at once, and if you do that, switch the bottom sheet with the top sheet after about 5 minutes and then continue cookie. Let cool. ; name: twix bar cookies ; ingredients: club crackers, margarine, milk, sugar, brown sugar, graham cracker, chocolate chips, crunchy peanut butter ; preparation:

name: fruited pot roast ; ingredients: dried prune, dried apricot, ground ginger, light beer, chuck roast, oil, onion, brown sugar, cinnamon, honey ; preparation:In the crock pot, soak the dried fruits and ginger in the beer for 1 to 2 hours. Stir in brown sugar, cinnamon, and honey. Brown meat in oil over medium high heat. Place the meat on top of the fruit in the crock pot. Cook on low setting for 10 to 12 hours, or on high for 5 to 6 hours. ; name: roasted corn and red pepper chowder crock pot slow cooker ; ingredients: olive oil, fresh corn kernels, red bell pepper, green onions, chicken broth, baking potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, evaporated milk, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:Heat olive oil in saute pan over medium heat. Add the corn, red pepper, and onions. Saute the vegetables until they are tender and lightly browned, about 7-8 minutes. Transfer sauted vegetables to slow cooker. Add the green onions, broth, potatoes, salt and pepper, and stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 7-9 hours or on high for 4-5 hours. Thirty minutes prior to serving, add the milk and blend well. Garnish with parsley to serve. ; name: crock pot slow cooker beef strips in mushroom gravy ; ingredients: steak, dry onion soup mix, mushroom soup, water, green capsicum, herbs, spices ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except meat in crock pot. Add meat. Cover and cook on low for 6 - 8 hours. Before serving, thicken gravy with flour or cornstarch mixed with a little water. Just before serving add 1 cup sour cream to gravy and stir well. Serve over noodles. ; name: incredibly good pot roast ; ingredients: chuck roast, olive oil, vidalia onions, salt and pepper, garlic, porter, beef broth ; preparation:Dry the roast on both sides and sprinkle with salt and fresh ground pepper. Heat oil in 5 qt dutch over. Brown chuck on both sides, remove from pan and set aside. Add sliced onions to the same pan and cook over medium heat until carmelized. This will take a little time, but be patient, it is worth it. Dont allow the onions to burn. I would guesstimate it will take approx 30 minutes. Now add the garlic and stir it around, cook for about a full minute. Place the roast on top of the onions, pour the beer and the broth over top and cover, allowing to cook on medium for the next 2 hours. Optional -- at the hour mark, you can add quartered potatoes and carrots if you want. We prefer to serve this over mashed potatoes though, the gravy is fab. ; name: roasted salmon fillets with irish whiskey ; ingredients: honey, cider vinegar, irish whiskey, fresh thyme, lemon zest, vegetable oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, salmon fillets ; preparation:Mix together honey, vinegar, whiskey, thyme, lemon zest, oil, salt and pepper. Pour over salmon and marinate 1 hour on the counter, or 4 hours refrigerated. Preheat oven to 450f. Remove salmon from marinade and place on a rack over a roasting pan. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, basting once with the marinade or until golden and white juices are just beginning to appear. Place on 4 plates and serve. ; name: easy slow cooker french dip ; ingredients: rump roast, beef broth, condensed french onion soup, beer, french rolls, butter ; preparation:Trim excess fat from the rump roast, and place in a slow cooker. Add the beef broth, onion soup and beer. Cook on low setting for 7 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Split french rolls, and spread with butter. Bake 10 minutes, or until heated through. Slice the meat on the diagonal, and place on the rolls. Serve the sauce for dipping. ; name: beef hot pot ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, beef stew meat, beef stock, butter, parsley, carrots ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Heat a little oil in frying pan and brown stew meat along with onions and carrots. Remove from pan. Layer sliced potatoes, onion, carrot and meat in a 3 pint casserole, finishing with a layer of potatoes. Pour over the stock. Brush the potatoes with 1 tbsp melted butter. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Remove the hot pot from the oven. Uncover and brush the potatoes again with melted butter or dripping. Return to the oven for a further 30 minutes, uncovered, to brown the potatoes. Serve garnished with parsley. ; name: slow cooker guinness roast ; ingredients: chuck, carrot, red potatoes, frozen pearl onions, lipton beef and onion soup mix, guinness stout ; preparation:

name: warm spinach and basil salad ; ingredients: spinach leaves, fresh basil, olive oil, garlic, pine nuts, prosciutto, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Combine the spinach and basil in a large salad bowl. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and pine nuts. Mix well. Saut until the pine nuts are brown. Add the prosciutto. Mix well. Cook just until heated through, stirring constantly. Pour over the spinach mixture, tossing to coat. Season with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. ; name: fruited spinach salad with honey mustard dressing ; ingredients: vinegar, honey, oil, poppy seed, dry mustard, fresh spinach, papayas, grapes ; preparation:In a screw top jar combine vinegar, oil, honey, poppy seed, and dry mustard cover. Shake well to mix. Combine spinach, papaya or pears, and grapes. Shake dressing again and pour over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: spinach salad with salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, salt and pepper, baby spinach, grape tomatoes, fresh goat cheese, pecans, vinaigrette ; preparation:Heat broiler, with rack set 4 inches from heat. Place salmon on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Broil, without turning, until opaque throughout, 7 to 9 minutes. Let cool briefly, then flake. Divide spinach and tomatoes among serving plates. Top with salmon, goat cheese, and pecans, and drizzle with vinaigrette. ; name: spinach cucumber salad with yogurt dressing ; ingredients: lemon juice, honey, yogurt, olive oil, of fresh mint, salt and pepper, baby spinach leaves, cucumbers, red onion ; preparation:Whisk the lemon juice and honey in a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the yogurt and olive oil together. Whisk while adding the yogurt to the lemon juice in a thin stream. Add the mint, then add the salt and pepper to taste. Cover and chill the dressing for up to 24 hours. Combine the spinach, cucumbers and onion in a large bowl. Season with a little salt and pepper. Add just enough dressing to moisten the salad. Toss to coat, and serve with extra dressing on the side. ; name: warm spinach and rice chicken salad ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, italian salad dressing, chicken rice pilaf mix, fresh spinach, tomatoes, pitted ripe olives ; preparation:Brush chicken with 2 teaspoons of the salad dressing. Grill or broil chicken, turning once, for 20 to 25 minutes or until juices run clear. Meanwhile, prepare rice pilaf mix according to package directions. Combine hot cooked rice with remaining salad dressing, spinach, tomatoes and olives. Stir until spinach is slightly wilted. Spoon rice mixture onto serving plates. Top with sliced chicken breast. ; name: baby spinach salad with lemon and parmesan ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil, garlic clove, baby spinach, parmesan cheese, coarse salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Place the lemon juice in a small bowl. Whisking constantly, slowly add the oil in a steady stream, whisking until the vinaigrette is creamy. Set aside. Rub the inside of a large bowl with the cut sides of the garlic halves. Add the spinach. Drizzle with the reserved lemon vinaigrette. Toss gently to coat. Divide the salad among 4 plates. Shave the cheese in wide sheets over each salad with a vegetable peeler. Season with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: fresh mushroom and spinach salad ; ingredients: tarragon, salt, garlic clove, fresh ground pepper, mushrooms, spinach, olive oil ; preparation:Mix vinegar, salt, garlic and pepper. Toss the mushrooms in the mixture and let stand for 15 minutes. Toss the spinach and oil until leaves glisten. Toss the mushroom mixture with spinach. Serve immediately. ; name: cantaloupe spinach salad ; ingredients: cantaloupe, fresh spinach leaves, pistachios, raspberry vinaigrette dressing ; preparation:

name: mashed potato spinach casserole ; ingredients: potatoes, sour cream, salt, pepper, butter, milk, frozen spinach, cheddar cheese, dill seed, chives ; preparation:Peel, cook and mash potatoes. Add sour cream, salt, pepper. Mix in enough milk to bring it to your favorite mashed potato consistency. Add spinach. Place in casserole dish and top with grated cheddar cheese. Bake in 350 oven for 20-30 minutes. We like to serve this with corn, which usually ends up mixed in with all the rest. ; name: company mashed potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, butter, milk, salt, heavy cream, gruyere cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Peel and quarter potatoes, cover with water, bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and mash, add the butter and gradually add milk. Mash until smooth and stir in salt. Place mashed potatoes in a greased shallow casserole dish and cover to keep warm. Preheat oven to 450. Whip heavy cream until stiff, then fold in gruyere cheese and 3 tablespoons of the parmesan cheese. Spread cream mixture over top of potatoes and sprinkle remaining parmesan over it. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until top is well browned. Serve immediately. ; name: farmer s breakfast casserole ; ingredients: frozen hash brown potatoes, monterey jack cheese, cooked ham, green onion, eggs, evaporated milk, pepper, salt ; preparation:Place potatoes in an 8 inch square baking dish which has been wiped down with shortening or sprayed with pam. Potatoes will thaw over night in the fridge. Sprinkle dish with cheese, ham and onions. In a separate bowl, beate eggs, evaporated milk, pepper and salt together. Pour into baking dish over the potato mixture. Cover and refridgerate for several hours or overnight. Remove from refridgerator 30 minutes before baking. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 55-60 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. ; name: creamy mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, garlic, butter, paprika ; preparation:Peel and boil potatoes until soft. Drain potatoes, and mash. Add cream cheese, sour cream, and minced garlic to potatoes and mix until smooth. Grease a 13x9 baking dish and add mashed potatoes. Set the 4 pats of butter in various spots on top of potatoes, sprinkle with paparika. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: twice baked mashed potatoes ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, fresh chives, bacon, seasoned pepper, salt, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Prepare potatoes according to package directions. Stir in cream cheese and next 5 ingredients. Place in a 2-quart, lightly greased, baking dish. The recipe states to divide the mixture evenly between 6, 6-oz. Lightly greased ramekins or custard cups- i preferred to make it in one big dish but you all can do as you like. Sprinkle evenly with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or till thoroughly heated. ; name: banana sweet potato puff casserole ; ingredients: mashed sweet potatoes, banana, curry powder, sour cream, salt, egg ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Beat with electric mixer until light and very fluffy. Turn into 1 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees f. In the oven for 20 minutes or until puffed and lightly browned. ; name: mashed potatoes extraordinaire ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, butter, onion powder, salt, pepper, paprika ; preparation:Cook potatoes as usual in salted water until tender. Drain. Push through potato ricer. Add cream cheese in pieces. Add next 5 ingredients. Beat until smooth and fluffy. Scrape into a 2 qt casserole. Place dabs of butter here and there over the top of the potatoes. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover and heat in 350 f oven until heated through. ; name: sandy s holiday mashed potato casserole ; ingredients: idaho potatoes, cream cheese, butter, sour cream, cream, eggs, salt, garlic salt ; preparation:

name: oatmeal buttermilk muffins ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, quick-cooking oatmeal, buttermilk, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar. Add egg. Add oatmeal. Add buttermilk. Then add flour. Salt baking powder and baking soda. Mix well. Bake in greased muffin tin 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: baked buttermilk pancakes ; ingredients: egg, butter, all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, buttermilk, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined. ; name: pancakes with fresh strawberries ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, milk, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, egg, strawberry, whipped cream ; preparation:Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Stir with a whisk to blend. In another bowl, whisk the milk, oil, vanilla, and egg together. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients just until combined. Do not overmix. Put a little oil on a griddle or large skillet and heat over medium-high heat. Drop the batter by tablespoons onto the griddle or in the pan to form several small pancakes. Cook until golden on each side. Transfer the pancakes to plates. Top the pancakes with a few strawberries and some whipped cream. ; name: sweet corn pancakes ; ingredients: eggs, half-and-half, sour cream, flour, baking soda, baking powder, corn, vegetable oil ; preparation:Beat the egg whites until they hold soft peaks when the beaters are lifted up. In another bowl, combine the egg yolks, half-and-half, and sour cream. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the egg yolk mixture. Add the beaten egg whites, using a gentle stirring motion to combine them with the yolk mixture. Add the corn and stir gently. Pour a small amount of oil into a non-stick pan and heat it over medium heat. Drop batter, about 1 tablespoon at a time, into the pan for each pancake and cook until golden brown on each side. Serve with butter if desired. ; name: breakfast eggcake ; ingredients: egg, milk, pancake mix, butter, bacon bits, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Stir ingredients together gently. Add more milk as necessary to make batter the consistency of buttermilk. Melt butter in omelette pan or small skillet over medium high heat. Pour batter into skillet and cook until edges appear dry. Flip eggcake over and cook until set, about another minute. Slide onto serving plate and serve with maple syrup or your favorite pancake topping. ; name: chocolate banana pancakes ; ingredients: banana, egg, vanilla extract, plain fat-free yogurt, water, baking powder, baking soda, sweetened cocoa powder, whole wheat flour, powdered sugar ; preparation:Mash the banana in a medium bowl. Add the egg, vanilla, yogurt, and water. Whisk until a bit frothy and smooth. In a smaller bowl mix the flour, baking soda, baking powder and cocoa powder. Sift it into the banana mixture. Mix until just blended. It will be thick. Use a ladle to drop some batter on a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Cook about 1-2 minutes per side. When bubbles form on one side, its time to flip them over. ; name: rich pancakes and waffles ; ingredients: eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, salt, butter, vanilla, nutmeg ; preparation:Seperate eggs and beat whites till fluffy but not dry, set aside. Mix all dry ingredients together, set aside. Beat yolks and milk. Slowly add dry ingredients beat till smooth. Mix in melted butter. Do not overbeat. Fold in egg whites. Cook over medium heat till golden. ; name: wheat n oat pancakes ; ingredients: quick-cooking rolled oats, skim milk, whole wheat flour, raw sugar, baking powder, salt, ground cinnamon, egg whites, canola oil, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: bacon cheese stuffed chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, mozzarella cheese, bacon, egg, italian breadcrumbs, olive oil, ragu hearty robusto pasta sauce, chicken broth, linguine ; preparation:Evenly top each chicken breast half with cheese and bacon. Roll up and secure with wooden toothpicks. Dip chicken in egg, then bread crumbs. In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium heat and brown chicken, turning occasionally. Stir in ragu pasta sauce and broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 10 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. To serve, arrange chicken and sauce over hot linguine or spaghetti. Garnish, if desired, with chopped fresh basil or parsley. ; name: chicken ranchero ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, olive oil, onion, garlic, green chilies, chicken broth, green chili salsa, cheddar cheese, cooked rice ; preparation:Saute chicken over medium heat, in olive oil about 5 minutes. Add onions and continue cooking until chicken is done and onions are soft. Add garlic, green chiles and broth. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Stir in salsa. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Gently fold in cubed cheddar cheese. Serve immediately over beds of rice. ; name: chicken stuffed with bacon and cheese ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, cheddar cheese, bacon, diced tomatoes, olive oil ; preparation:Cut a slit in each chicken breast. Stuff with cheese and crumbled bacon. Use a toothpick to secure the pocket closed. Brown stuffed chicken in olive oil in a fry pan until golden brown, then add diced tomatoes and cover, cooking until chicken is thoroughly done. Before serving, remove toothpicks. ; name: grilled caesar chicken breasts ; ingredients: caesar salad dressing, olive oil, dijon mustard, garlic cloves, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the dressing, oil, mustard and garlic. Add the chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 inches from the heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer reads 170. ; name: grilled buttermilk ranch marinated chicken breast ; ingredients: chicken breasts, buttermilk ranch dressing, lemon, juice and zest of, garlic cloves, olive oil, fresh ground pepper, fresh savory ; preparation:Wash and dry the chicken breasts and set aside. In the bowl of a food processor or blender, put in the ranch dip, lemon zest and juice, garlic, olive oil and fresh ground pepper. Process until well blended. Stir in the herbs. Place the chicken in a large zip loc bag and pour in the marinade to coat the chicken well. Close bag tightly and place in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat grill and when well heated, reduce to low. Lay the chicken on the grill, cover and check frequently to make sure chicken does not burn. It is important to cook the chicken slowly about 25-30 minutes turning once. ; name: butter baked chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, evaporated milk, flour, salt, pepper, butter, cream of chicken soup, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Dip chicken in milk, then roll in seasoned flour. Melt butter in 9 x 13 baking dish. Place chicken, skin side down, in butter. Cook 30 minutes. Mix water, remaining milk and soup together. Turn chicken and pour soup mixture over it. Bake 30 minutes more. Remove chicken and stir gravy. ; name: grilled chicken and cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: cooked chicken, raisins, almonds, celery, mayonnaise, monterey jack cheese, whole wheat bread, butter ; preparation:For the chicken mixture, stir the first five ingredients together. Using half the bread place 1 slice of cheese on each slice of bread. Spread the chicken mixture on evenly and top with cheese. Spread butter on one side of each of the sandwiches, cook with butter side down on medium heat for about three minutes or until light and brown. Spread the other side with remaining butter and cook for three minutes. ; name: mother and child reunion ; ingredients: oil, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, ranch dressing, italian breadcrumbs, butter, eggs, bacon, american cheese, rolls ; preparation:

name: potato egg bake ; ingredients: butter, onion, frozen hash browns, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese, bacon ; preparation:Cook, drain and crumble bacon. Melt butter or margarine in a skillet. Add onions and hash browns. Cook and stir until potatoes are lightly browned. Grease a 9x13 inch pan and place hash browns in the bottom of the pan. Beat eggs, milk and salt and pepper 1- 2 minutes. Stir in grated cheese and bacon. Pour over potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees 45-50 minutes, until a knife inserted comes out clean. ; name: fried potato patties ; ingredients: potatoes, mozzarella cheese, egg, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, breadcrumbs, vegetable oil ; preparation:Combine first 7 ingredients. Chill. Shape mixture into 6 patties. Dip each patty into lightly beaten egg then lightly coat with breadcrumbs. Heat vegetable oil and fry over medium heat until lightly browned, turning once. ; name: chili sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, hickory smoked bacon, chili powder, butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place sliced potatoes in an oven going glass dish in one layer, overlapping potatoes. Sprinkle chili powder over potatoes. Dot with butter. Lay strips of bacon on top. Bake in a 350 oven until bacon is crisp. ; name: ww sliced baked potatoes 4 points ; ingredients: baking potatoes, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, butter, fresh herbs, salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Peel the potatoes if the skin is too tough, otherwise just scrub and rinse them. Cut the potatoes into thin slices. Put the potatoes in a baking dish. Slightly fan out the slices. Drizzle the potatoes with melted butter and sprinkle with herbs and salt. Bake the potatoes for about 50 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven, sprinkle with parmesan and cheddar cheese. Bake the potatoes for another 10-15 minutes. ; name: chive mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, milk, fresh chives, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Boil potatoes for 10-12 minutes or until fork-tender. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Mash potatoes, adding cream cheese until it is blended. Stir in milk, chives, and seasonings. Heat on medium heat until just warmed through, then serve at once. ; name: potatoes on the half shell ; ingredients: baking potatoes, milk, butter, egg, salt, pepper, green onion, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f degrees. Scrub the potatoes and place them in the oven until done, about 1 hour. Cut each potato in half, lengthwise. Carefully, scoop out the potato and place in a bowl. Set the potato shells aside to use later. While still hot, mash the potatoes with the milk, beaten egg, and butter. Beat until fluffy. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Add in the onion. Spread the potato shells with butter and fill each shell with the potato mixture. Sprinkle the tops with parmesan cheese. Bake until tops are browned. ; name: sweet potato latkes ; ingredients: sweet potato, potato, onion, flour, baking powder, eggs, salt and pepper, fresh parsley, fresh chives ; preparation:Coarsely grate potatoes and drain well. Place potatoes in a mixing bowl with all remaining ingredients and mix together. Cover and leave to stand for 1 hour. Heat oil for shallow frying in a frying pan and drop large spoonfuls of the mixture as for small pancakes and fry until golden brown on both sides and cooked in the middle, about 5 minutes. Drain well on paper towels and keep hot until ready to serve. Eat immediately. ; name: potato skins t g i friday s potato skins ; ingredients: baking potatoes, sour cream, fresh chives, butter, cheddar cheese, cooked bacon ; preparation:

name: chamomile pomegranate tea ; ingredients: chamomile tea bags, boiling water, pomegranate juice, splenda sugar substitute, mint sprig ; preparation:Place tea bags in a large heat-proof measuring cup or pitcher. Pour boiling water over tea bags. Steep 1 hour, or until cooled to room temperature. Remove and discard tea bags. Add pomegranate juice and splenda, stirring until it dissolves. Serve over ice. Garnish with mint sprigs. Makes 4, 1 cup servings. ; name: caramel custard pudim flan ; ingredients: soft brown sugar, sugar, eggs, milk, coffee extract ; preparation:Put a heaped teaspoon of brown sugar into 6 individual ramekins. In a large bowl, beat sugar and eggs together until yellow and frothy. Bring milk to boil, gradually add it to the egg mixture, beating constantly. Add coffee essence. Pour this mixture into ramekins, place in roasting pan. Add enough water to come half way up the sides of the ramekins. Bake in a moderate oven, 350 degrees until just set, about 45 minutes. To test, stick a skewer into the custard, if it comes out clean, the custard is done. Remove from oven and allow to cool. ; name: dried cherry and pecan oatmeal ; ingredients: water, nonfat milk, whole oats, dried cherries, salt, brown sugar, butter, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, pecans ; preparation:Bring the first 5 ingredients to a boil. Lower heat and simmer, stirring occasionally for 20 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in 4 tablespoons brown sugar and the next 3 ingredients. Spoon 1 cup of oatmeal into each of 6 bowls. Sprinkle evenly with pecans and the remaining brown sugar. Serve immediately. ; name: cherry blossom fudge ; ingredients: evaporated milk, white sugar, salt, cherry gelatin, butter, semi-sweet chocolate chips, vanilla extract, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Butter an 8x8 inch pan. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil and stir in gelatin. Boil 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in butter, chocolate chips, vanilla and cherries. Pour into prepared pan. Chill 2 hours before serving. ; name: creamy pralines ; ingredients: light brown sugar, salt, evaporated milk, butter, pecan halves ; preparation:Mix the sugar, salt, milk and butter in a heavy pot. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves. Add the pecans and cook over medium heat, stirring often, until it reaches the soft ball stage. Remove from heat. Allow to cool for a couple of minutes, then stir rapidly until the mixture begins to thicken and lightly coats the pecans. Drop by tablespoons onto wax or parchment paper. When the pralines have cooled, gently lift from the surface with a knife and store in an airtight container. ; name: quick party pitcher ; ingredients: frozen limeade concentrate, apple juice, ginger ale, ice, maraschino cherry ; preparation:In a large pitcher combine limeade and apple juice. Shake vigorously. Add ginger ale. Put ice in glasses, pour in mixture. Top with maraschino cherries. ; name: sugar and spice pepitas ; ingredients: pepitas, sugar, egg white, chili powder, cinnamon, salt, ground cumin, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f and spray baking sheet with nonstick spray. Mix all ingredients and spread in single layer on baking sheet. Bake until pepitas are golden and dry, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and separate pepitas with fork while still warm. Cool completely. ; name: pomegranate tapioca ; ingredients: pomegranates, sugar, grenadine, water, tapioca, whipped cream ; preparation:

name: sweet and sour stir fry ; ingredients: broccoli florets, yellow pepper, green onions, vegetable oil, pork tenderloin, stir-fry sauce, cooked rice, orange ; preparation:In a large nonstick skillet, cook broccoli, pepper, and onion in hot oil over medium high heat for 4 minutes or until tender crisp. Transfer from skillet to a medium bowl. Add pork to skillet and stir fry for 2-3 minutes or until done. Return the vegetables to skillet and add sauce. Stir to coat and heat through. Serve over rice garnished with orange sliced. ; name: veggie stir fry ; ingredients: broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, baby carrots, bamboo shoot, water chestnut, scallion, teriyaki marinade, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil, garlic, and scallions in saut pan for about 1 minute. Add broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots and saut on medium heat adding cup of water can help steam the vegetables. Cover pan for about 2 minutes. Add bamboo shoots, water chestnuts and 2 cups teriyaki marinade. Cover for 1 to 2 minutes. Then uncover and saut until done ideally 1 more minute to keep veggies crisp. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: chilli jam beef stir fry ; ingredients: red chilies, gingerroot, onion, shrimp paste, brown sugar, vegetable oil, beef, scallions, green beans ; preparation:Place first 6 ingredients into a food processor and process until finely chopped. Over medium-high, heat a non-stick frying pan then add the chilli paste. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring, until the mix is thick and fragrant. Depending on the water content of the ingredients this may take even longer. Now add the beef and cook for 3 more minutes, stirring the whole time. Add the scallions and beans. Cover. Cook for another 3 minutes, or until beef & vegetables are tender. Serve with steamed rice. ; name: beef hot pot ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, beef stew meat, beef stock, butter, parsley, carrots ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Heat a little oil in frying pan and brown stew meat along with onions and carrots. Remove from pan. Layer sliced potatoes, onion, carrot and meat in a 3 pint casserole, finishing with a layer of potatoes. Pour over the stock. Brush the potatoes with 1 tbsp melted butter. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Remove the hot pot from the oven. Uncover and brush the potatoes again with melted butter or dripping. Return to the oven for a further 30 minutes, uncovered, to brown the potatoes. Serve garnished with parsley. ; name: stir fry mushrooms and bell peppers ; ingredients: olive oil, green onions, garlic cloves, bell peppers, champignon mushrooms, chinese rice wine, soy sauce, sesame oil ; preparation:Heat oil til really hot. Stir fry onions, then garlic. Then add peppers and mushrooms. Stir-fry until it becomes a bit soft,. Add the wine and soy sauce and continue to stir for 2 minutes. When done, remove from heat and add the sesame sauce mixing it all together, and serve. ; name: quick asian style vegetable beef skillet ; ingredients: ground beef, garlic powder, seasoning salt, carrots, white onion, water, cabbage, green pepper, soy sauce, beef-flavor ramen noodles ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook the beef, seasoned salt, garlic powder, carrots and onions until beef is browned and veggies are crisp tender. Drain and return to skillet. Add water, cabbage, green peppers, soy sauce and seasoning packet from the noodles. Break noodles into small pieces, add to pan and stir well to cover noodles with liquid. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and noodles are tender. ; name: tofu green onion stir fry ; ingredients: extra firm tofu, peanut oil, green onion, vegetable stock, soy sauce, garlic, jalapeno peppers, salt and pepper ; preparation:Unwrap the tofu and place chopped tofu on paper towels to help it drain more, leave it for apprx 1 hour when the tofu has drained heat the oil in a wok or skillet and over medium heat stir fry the tofu and garlic until heated through and lightly browned add the green onions and peppers. Stir fry for 3 minutes. Add veggie stock and continue cooking until it is reduced by half only takes a minute. Add soy sauce, turn off heat and mix well. Season to taste. Garnish with green onion tops& serve. ; name: reasonable beef stir fry ; ingredients: beef, olive oil, bell peppers, onions, seasoning, hoisin sauce, water ; preparation:

name: crumb coated baked chicken ; ingredients: buttermilk, hot pepper sauce, seasoned bread crumbs, yellow cornmeal, salt, dried cilantro, chili powder, cayenne pepper, ground cumin, skinless chicken breasts ; preparation:Line a 15x10 inch baking pan with foil. Coat the foil with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside. In a shallow bowl, combine buttermilk and hot pepper sauce. In another bowl, combine the bread crumbs, cornmeal and seasonings. Dip chicken in buttermilk mixture, then roll in crumb mixture. Place bone side down in prepared pan. Spritz chicken with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven. Spritz again with nonstick cooking spray. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer or until a meat thermometer reads 170 degrees fahrenheit. ; name: baked cornflake chicken strips ; ingredients: corn flakes, all-purpose flour, seasoning salt, black pepper, poultry seasoning, eggs, water, boneless chicken breasts, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Finely crush cornflakes. Mix together cornflakes, flour, seasoning salt, pepper and poultry seasoning. Beat eggs with water. Dip chicken strips in egg mixture and then roll in cornflake mixture. Press mixture firmly onto chicken to coat well. Lay chicken strips on baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender and cooked throughly. Baking time varies depending on size of strips. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. These can also be fried in oil for 6-8 minutes but i prefer baking to keep them healthier. ; name: crock pot orange honey chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, orange juice, chicken broth, honey, dry mustard, teriyaki sauce, broccoli floret, cauliflower floret, carrot ; preparation:Place frozen breasts in crock pot. Mix juice, broth, honey, dry mustard and teryiaki sauce. Pour over chicken in crock. Cook on low for four hours. Add vegetables about one hour before serving. Place on top of chicken and do not stir. Cook the additional hour and serve over rice. ; name: crock pot chicken cheese dip ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, rotel tomatoes & chilies, water, velveeta cheese, onion powder, garlic powder, flour, light sour cream, tortilla chips ; preparation:Blend the tomatoes & chilies in a food processor then pour into a crock pot. Add the water & frozen chicken breasts, cover with a lid & cook on low for 3 hours. Remove the chicken & shred, place back into the crock pot. Stir in the velveeta & spices. Mix the flour with a small amount of water. Stir into the crock pot & recover with a lid. Cook for another hour. Turn off the pot then stir in the sour cream. Serve warm with tortilla chips. ; name: devilish chicken and corn on the cob ; ingredients: whole chicken, margarine, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, dried thyme, salt, cayenne pepper, corn on the cob, dry breadcrumbs ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 400f. In a bowl, stir together melted butter, mustard, vinegar, thyme, salt and cayenne pepper. Brush corn and each chicken piece thouroughly with the butter mixture. Arrange chicken in one layer in large baking dish and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Set corn in a seperate baking dish, covering with aluminum foil. Bake both dishes for one hour, serve hot. ; name: cornflake ranch chicken fingers or breasts ; ingredients: chicken tenders, fat free ranch dressing, skim milk, hot sauce, corn flake crumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, salt and pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Mix dressing, milk and hot sauce. Pour over chicken in sealed container. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes longer if you have time. When ready to cook, preheat oven to 350f spray nonstick pan with cooking spray, set aside. Mix crumbs and spices. Dredge chicken in crumb mixture shaking off excess. Place chicken on prepared pan and place in oven for 15 to 20 mins or till 160f. Serve with your favorite dippers. ; name: simple honey baked chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breast halves, dijon mustard, honey, curry powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Place chicken in baking dish. Combine mustard, honey and curry powder. Spread over chicken pieces. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Baste while baking and be careful that sauce does not burn. ; name: honey corn flake crumb chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, honey, dijon mustard, salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, corn flakes ; preparation:

name: parmesan and garlic fries ; ingredients: russet potatoes, olive oil, garlic cloves, thyme, seasoning salt, parmesan cheese, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. In a large mixing bowl, place the cut potatoes and pour the olive oil over the top. Sprinkle on the garlic, thyme and seasoned salt. Mix well until the potatoes are evenly coated. Spread the potatoes on a baking sheet in a single layer. Do not throw away the oil that is left in the bowl. Bake 30 minutes, turning the fries over halfway through. After 30 minutes of baking, return the fries to the bowl with excess oil and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and parsley. Toss to coat and return to baking sheet and bake for another 10 minutes. If desired, sprinkle fries again with a few shakes of parmesan and a few shakes of seasoned salt. ; name: zesty oven fries ; ingredients: baking potatoes, fresh parmesan cheese, olive oil, sea salt, garlic powder, paprika, fresh coarse ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Peel potatoes & cut into thick fries or wedges. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray or cover with rapid release foil. Combine salt, garlic powder, paprika, & pepper and place in large ziploc bacg. Drizzle olive oil over potatoes and coat evenly. Place potatoes in bag and shake to coat. Arrange potatoes in single layer on baking sheet. Bake 35 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: cheesy scalloped potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, white flour, onion, celery leaves, parsley flakes, butter, salt, pepper, milk, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Put flour, onion, celery leaves, parsley, butter, salt, pepper and milk into blender. Mix on high about 2 minutes. Arrange potatoe slices in buttered 2 quart baking dish. Pour onion mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven 1 hour. Uncovered. Can be frozen and reheated. I always make two at a time and stash one in the freezer. ; name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: chili dog fries ; ingredients: french-fried potatoes, fat-free vegetarian chili, hot dogs, onion, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Prepare fries according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a microwave-safe dish, combine the chili, hot dogs and onion. Cover and microwave on high for 5 or 6 minutes or until heated through, stirring once. Serve over fries. Sprinkle with cheese. ; name: loaded potato fries ; ingredients: waffle-shaped french fries, steak seasoning, cheddar cheese, green onions, bacon bits ; preparation:Arrange waffle fries in a greased 15 x 10 inch baking pan. Bake at 450 for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with steak seasoning. Toss to coat. Top with cheese, onions, and bacon bits. Bake 2-3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. ; name: oven baked crispy potato fries ; ingredients: idaho baking potatoes, olive oil, fresh rosemary, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 550 degrees. Halve each potato, then cut each half in 5 slices lengthwise. Place on a baking sheet and drizzle the olive oil over them, work the potatoes around in the oil until evenly coated. Season with the rosemary, salt, pepper and red pepper. Throw the garlic cloves on the sheet with the potatoes. Roast 25 minutes. Make sure to turn them all once at the halfway point or they will end up sticking to the baking sheet. ; name: brit s cheesy onion home fries ; ingredients: russet potatoes, butter, salt, fresh ground black pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, onion, parsley ; preparation:

name: honey garlic pork chops ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, honey, lemon juice, low sodium soy sauce, garlic clove ; preparation:In lg. Skillet, coated with nonstick spray, brown chops on both sides. Cook over medium heat till juices run clear. In a bowl, combine the honey, lemon juice, soy sauce, and garlic. Remove chops and keep warm. Add honey mixture to the skillet. Cook over medium heat for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour over chops. ; name: chili jam ; ingredients: garlic, onions, birds eye chiles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, white sugar, peanut oil ; preparation:Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add garlic and onion and cook on a low slow heat until the onions are transparent. Add chillies to the garlic and onion mixture and cook until the chillies are soft. Again being careful not to brown or burn the garlic, onion and chilli mixture. Next, to the mixture in the saucepan, add the tamarind paste, fish sauce and the sugar. Simmer for ten minutes then turn off heat. Cool for a few minutes and then pour the mixture into a blender or food processor and blend until the mixture is the consistency of jam. Pour into sterilised jam jar and store in fridge. The chilli jam will last for a couple of weeks in the fridge. ; name: curly kale with caramelized onions ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, kale, balsamic vinegar, almonds ; preparation:Heat oil in large pot or dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, and cook 10 to 15 minutes, or until soft and beginning to brown. Add garlic, and cook 1 minute, or until fragrant. Stir in kale and 2 cups water. Cover, and cook 30 minutes, or until kale is tender. Season with salt and pepper. If making ahead, cool, and store in airtight container. Just before serving, reheat kale mixture, then drizzle with vinegar, and sprinkle with almonds. ; name: chili lime shrimp kabobs ; ingredients: lime juice, olive oil, white wine vinegar, garlic cloves, chili powder, salt, pepper, raw shrimp, vegetables ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first seven ingredients. Add the shrimp. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Drain and discard marinade. On each of 12 metal or soaked wooden appetizer skewers, thread two shrimp and any veggies you want to add. Grill kabobs, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 inches from the heat for 5-8 minutes or until shrimp turn pink, turning once. ; name: baked honey onions ; ingredients: chicken broth, butter, honey, lemon, zest of, paprika, black peppercorns, parsley, white onions, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. Mix all ingredients except onions and cheese together. Coat 9x11 casserole with nonstick cooking spray. Place the onions in a single layer in the casserole and pour chicken broth mixture evenly over all the onions. Cover onions and bake for 1 hour. After hour, remove and sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven uncovered and bake 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: island pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, salt, pepper, chili powder, ground cumin, cinnamon, olive oil, brown sugar, fresh garlic, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Stir together salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin and cinnamon. Coat the pork with the spice rub. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a 12 inch skillet, over relatively high heat, and brown pork, turning every 30 seconds for 4 minutes. Stir together brown sugar, garlic, and tabasco and pat onto top of the tenderloin. Place pork in roasting pan and cook for 20 minutes. ; name: tender pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, garlic clove, salt, pepper, ground cumin, extra virgin olive oil, chicken broth, dry white wine ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. With the top of a sharp knife, make deep little slits all over the tenderloin and insert the garlic slivers. Season with salt, pepper and cumin. Place the oil in an oven-proof skillet and sear the tenderloin well over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes, turning the meat over as it browns. Add the chicken broth and white wine to the pan, and place it in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove it and let it rest, covered with foil, for 10-12 minutes before carving. It will continue to cook as it sits. Slice and serve immediately. ; name: jamaican baste ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, chili, ground allspice, ground cinnamon, lime, sugar ; preparation:

name: sugar coated molasses cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, molasses, eggs, flour, salt, baking soda, ground ginger, ground cloves, ground cinnamon ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar. Beat in the molasses and eggs. Separately, combine the dry ingredients, then slowly mix into the wet ingredients. When blended and smooth, roll the dough into small balls, about 1 inch around. Dip the tops in sugar and place on greased or non-stick baking sheets. Bake at 350f or 180c for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack, then store in a tightly covered container to keep the cookies soft. ; name: easy gingersnap cookies ; ingredients: molasses, butter, flour, ginger, baking soda, salt ; preparation:Pretheat oven to 425. Grease a baking sheet. Heat molasses in saucepan, until it boils. Put the butter into large mixing bowl, combine hot molasses. Sift together salt, baking soda and flour. Blend in ginger. Blend mixture well. Let mixture chill in refrigerator, just until cold. Take out, roll batter very thin. Cut with cookie cutter. Using the spatula, put on baking sheet. Bake for approximately 5 minutes, or until golden. ; name: pumpkin molasses muffins ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, canned pumpkin, molasses, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, ground ginger, pecans ; preparation:Beat butter at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy. Gradually add brown sugar, beating well. Add egg, beating well. Add pumpkin and molasses, beating well. Combine flour and next 3 ingredients. Gradually add to pumpkin mixture, beating at medium-low just until blended. Stir in pecans. Spoon into greased muffin pans, filling three-fourths full. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes. Remove from pans immediately. ; name: molasses toffees ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, baking soda, salt, light molasses, all-purpose flour, nuts ; preparation:Cream together shortening, sugar, soda, salt and molasses. Blend in flour and nuts. Spread in greased 15x16-inch pan. Bake at 350f for 15 to 20 minutes. Cut into squares while warm. ; name: eggless autumn spice cookies ; ingredients: flour, salt, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, ground ginger, baking soda, dark brown sugar, white sugar, sugar, maple syrup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix flour, baking soda, ginger, cloves, cinnamon, and salt. Set aside. Cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Add maple syrup, blend. Slowly add the dry ingredients, mix well. Drop a tablespoon at a time in the reserved sugar, coat and roll in to a ball. Place on parchment lined cookiesheet at least an inch apart. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Store in a sealed bag. ; name: moist and spicy gingerbread squares low fat ; ingredients: margarine, light brown sugar, molasses, egg white, all-purpose flour, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, baking soda, salt, applesauce ; preparation:Beat margarine and sugar until well blended. Beat in molasses and egg white. Combine dry ingredients. Add to wet, alternately with applesauce mixing well after each addition. Bake in a 350 degree f oven in a greased 8 inch baking pan 25 to 30 minutes, or until toothpick in center comes out clean. Cool and cut into squares, frost if desired. ; name: molasses mustard ; ingredients: mustard seeds, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, white wine vinegar, molasses ; preparation:Mix the mustard seeds and spices in a bowl, pour the vinegar on top and leave to soak overnight. Place the mixture in a mortar and pound to a paste. Gradually work in the molasses. The finished mustard should resemble a stiff paste, so add extra vinegar if necessary. Store the mustard in sterilized jars in the fridge. Use within 4 weeks. ; name: a molasses ginger snaps ; ingredients: molasses, sugar, egg, crisco shortening, flour, salt, cinnamon, clove, ginger ; preparation:

name: creamy clam chowder ; ingredients: bacon, celery, onion, butter, flour, clam juice, half-and-half cream, clams, white pepper ; preparation:In a medium skillet over medium heat, cook bacon, celery, and onion until onion is translucent. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to form a roux, cooking until bubbly. Whisk in 1 jar of clam juice, until smooth. Stir in onion mixture. Pour in half-and-half, and rest of clam juice, stirring constantly. Stir in clams, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Season with pepper and serve. ; name: clams with garlic and almonds tapas ; ingredients: littleneck clams, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, sliced almonds, dry white wine, lemons, juice and zest of, scallions, parsley ; preparation:Scrub and drain cockles and set aside. In a 12-inch to 14-inch saute pan, heat oil until smoking. Add garlic and almonds and saute until golden brown. Add clams, wine and lemon juice and zest and bring to a boil. Cover and cook until clams open, about 3 to 4 minutes. Uncover, add scallions and parsley and serve. ; name: crock pot yummy bbq pork sandwiches ; ingredients: pork shoulder, beef broth, barbecue sauce, hamburger buns ; preparation:Place pork in crock pot. Pour can of beef broth over pork. Cook for about 10 hours or until meat shreds easily. Remove meat and shred with two forks. Stir the meat with barbecue sauce in a hot skillet on the stove and serve on hamburger buns. ; name: linguini and clams ; ingredients: baby clams, half-and-half, white wine, garlic, butter, fresh basil, linguine, parmesan cheese, parsley ; preparation:Heat a saute pan on medium high heat. Add in garlic, butter, wine, and half and half. Cook for 10 minutes or until reduced by half. Add in the fresh basil and the clams. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Portion a half cup of linguini on each plate, top each plate with equal portions of the clam sauce.
